0.title: Cummins is happy if we drop chances as long as ball carries, jokes Smith
0.article_body: Discussing pitches for Pakistan's Tests against Australia, Steve Smith said there is no bounce, joking that Australia Test captain Pat Cummins is happy if the slip fielders drop chances as long as the ball carries. "I've never stood as close to the bat for pace bowlers in my life, in any conditions," added Smith. "It's been exceptionally difficult," stated Smith.

1.title: SP-ally Rajbhar denies meeting Shah, says 'old pic' circulating
1.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief OP Rajbhar, an ally of SP, has denied reports of him meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Those are old photos. Someone can repost the old photos and say whatever they want," said Rajbhar. "The reports are baseless. Neither did I go to Delhi nor did I meet anyone," Rajbhar added.

2.title: We must give up colonial mindset, take pride in Indian identity: Naidu
2.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday asked Indians to give up their "colonial mindset" and learn to take pride in their own identity. He also called for total rejection of the Macaulay system of education in the 75th year of Independence. "We must learn Sanskrit to know our scriptures, which are a treasure trove of knowledge," he said.

3.title: Inspired by film Valimai, 2 men steal bikes in Coimbatore; arrested
3.article_body: Inspired by the film Valimai starring Ajith, a 23-year-old man and his 17-year-old neighbour allegedly stole motorcycles in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The Saravanampatti police arrested them on Wednesday. "Inspired by the movie, they started to steal parked motorcycles and sold them for as low as 5,000," Inspector Senthilkumar said. Police also recovered 11 motorcycles from their possession.

4.title: 25,000 jobs to be notified in 1 month: Punjab CM after cabinet meet
4.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann presided over his first cabinet meeting on Saturday and later said the cabinet passed a proposal to issue 25,000 government job notifications in one month. This includes 10,000 vacancies in Punjab Police and 15,000 vacancies in other government departments. "As we promised...job opportunities...will be the top priority of the AAP government," Mann said.

5.title: It is meant for global audience: Vidya Balan on 'Jalsa' releasing on OTT
5.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan while talking about her film 'Jalsa' getting released on OTT rather than the theatres said the film is meant for the global audience. "Both the story and the narrative are universal," said Vidya Balan. Actress Shefali Shah, who also stars in the film, added, "We all want to be a part of global cinema."

6.title: They are a part of us: Maniesh Paul on ill-treatment of LGBTQ+ community
6.article_body: Actor and TV host Maniesh Paul while expressing his disappointment on the ill-treatment of LGBTQ+ community said, "They are very much...part of us." "They are part of our world and society whom we were ignoring for a long time," he added while talking to former Mr Gay India Sushant Divgikr in the latest episode of 'The Maniesh Paul Podcast'.

7.title: 6.5 million people displaced inside Ukraine due to war: UN
7.article_body: The UN migration agency said that nearly 6.5 million people are displaced within Ukraine and over 3.2 million have fled the country due to war. "Over 12 million people are estimated to be stranded in affected areas or unable to leave due to heightened security risks, destruction of...roads...lack of resources or information on where to find safety," it added.

8.title: There were times I'd be desperate when I was about to get dropped: Dhawan
8.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said there were times when he would be desperate when he was about to be dropped from Team India, adding that he used to compete aggressively. "I have seen...ups and downs playing for the Indian team," stated Dhawan. "T20 World Cup 2022 is coming. If I do well in...IPL 2022, I can get into the side," he said.

9.title: India's forex reserves decline by $9.6 bn in biggest weekly drop in 2 yrs
9.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves declined by $9.646 billion to $622.275 billion in the week ending March 11, marking its biggest weekly drop in nearly two years, data shared by the Reserve Bank of India showed. The decline was on account of a fall in foreign currency assets (FCA), a major component of the overall reserves, which decreased by $11.108 billion.

10.title: Bulgaria won't send military aid to Ukraine: PM Petkov
10.article_body: Bulgarian PM Kiril Petkov said the country will not be able to provide military aid to Ukraine as it's "too close to the conflict". Bulgaria, a NATO ally, will continue to provide humanitarian assistance, he added. Bulgaria also announced that it'll host a new contingent of NATO troops as part of the military alliance's push to strengthen its eastern flank.

11.title: As a leader you have to do it: Gambhir on IPL 2013 spat with Kohli
11.article_body: Discussing his spat with Virat Kohli while leading KKR in an IPL 2013 match against RCB, Gautam Gambhir said, "When you are leading...you have to do it...because you want your team to play...[like] you want." "You are not thinking about personal relationships with the other guy," added Gambhir. Ex-KKR player Rajat Bhatia had to step in and separate them.

12.title: I learnt a lot from bad IPL 2021 season, won't let it change me: Pooran
12.article_body: Having scored 85 runs in 12 IPL 2021 matches for PBKS, West Indies wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran said he has learnt a lot from his "bad" season but won't let it change him as a player. "First game...I got a first-ball duck..., next game...a second-ball duck," added Pooran. Pooran recorded four ducks in his opening six IPL 2021 matches.

13.title: Police probe into hijab row targeted us, alleges CFI's K'taka head
13.article_body: The Karnataka chief of the Campus Front of India (CFI), Athavulla Punjalkatte, has alleged that the police probe into the hijab row was "selective" and "targeted" the organisation. In an interview with the Indian Express, Punjalkatte reacted to the Karnataka High Court's judgement uphold the ban on hijab by saying, "We are with petitioner students and we'll fight it legally."

14.title: 20-year-old arrested for kidnapping & raping 17-year-old girl in UP
14.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and raping a 17-year-old girl. On December 22, the girl had gone missing from a village under Rasra police station. Her father registered a case on February 16. Acting on a tip-off, the police arrested the accused on Thursday. The girl was sent for medical examination to the district hospital.

15.title: What are the features of Kinzhal hypersonic missiles used by Russia in Ukraine?
15.article_body: Russia has claimed to have used Kinzhal (meaning dagger) hypersonic missiles in Ukraine to blast a weapons' storage. They have a reported range of 1,500-2,000 km and can carry a payload that's 33 times the yield of the Fat Man bomb that was dropped on Hiroshima. They fly at 10 times the speed of sound and can overcome air-defence systems.

16.title: Kiara praises her dad's 'childhood friend' Juhi Chawla, calls her 'aunty'
16.article_body: Kiara Advani, during an interview, referred to Juhi Chawla as "aunty" while revealing that the actress is her father Jagdeep Advani's childhood friend. When pointed out that she called Juhi "aunty", Kiara laughed and said she doesn't think Juhi will "kill" her for it. "She's very grounded. I never felt that she was a huge film star," Kiara further said.

17.title: Ready to ally with Cong or NCP; not 'B' team of BJP: AIMIM MP
17.article_body: Aurangabad MP and AIMIM leader, Imtiaz Jaleel, has said that his party is willing to ally with the NCP and Congress for civic polls in Maharashtra. Jaleel said that it is always alleged that BJP wins because of AIMIM splitting votes. Jaleel added that to prove AIMIM is not a 'B' team of BJP, he "proposed...for the alliance".

18.title: It took me to really dark places: Arjun on 1 yr of 'Sandeep Aur Pinky...'
18.article_body: As 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' completed one year of its release on Saturday, Arjun Kapoor said, "[It] took me to really dark places in my heart." "Though it was extremely uncomfortable for me, it made me deliver a performance that people have called my career-best," he added. Directed by Dibakar Banerjee, the crime drama also featured Parineeti Chopra.

19.title: Pressure like batting on Day 1: Du Plessis on first RCB training session
19.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis compared his first RCB training session after three days of quarantine, to the pressure of batting on the first day in a Test match. Du Plessis will be leading an IPL franchise for the first time, having replaced Virat Kohli who was the franchise's captain from 2013 to 2021. He has played 100 IPL matches.

20.title: Noida, Ghaziabad to host school books exchange fair tomorrow
20.article_body: Ghaziabad Parents Association and Gautam Budh Nagar Parents Welfare Society will organise a school books exchange fair tomorrow. Parents will be able to donate their child's old school books and in return, they can get books donated by others for their child's new academic session. The fair will be held in Noida's Sector 52 community hall and Ghaziabad's Shastri Nagar.

21.title: Which superyachts owned by Russians have been seized due to the war in Ukraine?
21.article_body: Several superyachts have been seized from Russian oligarchs after sanctions by US and European Union due to Ukraine war. The seized superyachts include 213-foot Lady M owned by Alexei Mordashov, Gennady Timchenko's 132-foot Lena, Andrey Melnichenko's 470-foot-long Sy A, 279-foot Valerie, 289-foot Amore Vero owned by Igor Sechin, 450-foot Dilbar and 445-foot Crescent and 157-foot Lady Anastasia.

22.title: 112 children killed in ongoing war in Ukraine: Official
22.article_body: At least 112 children have been killed in the war in Ukraine so far, the Ukrainian prosecutor general's office said on Saturday. Around 140 children have been injured, it added. On Friday, scores of empty strollers were lined up in the central square of Lviv city to commemorate the children killed in the country since Russia's invasion.

23.title: Kohli forces himself to hit by using the crease in the powerplay: Jaffer
23.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it seems like Virat Kohli forces himself to hit by using the crease in the powerplay, adding that Kohli should bat at number three rather than opening the innings for RCB. "Kohli's somebody who takes some time initially and then his strike rate progressively goes up," stated Jaffer. Kohli scored 405 runs in IPL 2021.

24.title: 16-yr-old girl shot in back, lungs by Russian soldiers while saving brother, survives
24.article_body: A 16-year-old Ukrainian girl was shot in the back, lungs, ribs and thighs by Russian troops while covering her eight-year-old brother from the attack. The girl survived the attack and is currently hospitalised in Kyiv. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy also visited the girl and her family at the hospital and gave her a bouquet of pink and white flowers.

25.title: Drunk man stabs self 4 times while dancing on Holi in MP, video surfaces
25.article_body: A man who appeared to be drunk stabbed himself four times with a knife while dancing during a Holi celebration in MP's Indore. A video of the incident shows the man accidentally stabbing himself while reportedly appearing to pull off a stunt. He was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed to his injuries, police said.

26.title: Czech designer makes 'Zelenskyy pillows', raises over ₹14 lakh for Ukraine
26.article_body: A Czech designer is making pillows bearing the portrait of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who according to him has become a “sex symbol” for some. Tomas Brinek said that he has already received 2,000 orders for these pillows and has raised $18,900 (over ₹14 lakh) for a charity helping Ukrainians amid the war.

27.title: Our film important too: 'Jhund' maker as Kashmir Files declared tax-free
27.article_body: Reacting to 'The Kashmir Files' being made tax-free in multiple states across the country, Savita Raj Hiremath, one of the producers of 'Jhund', said she's "perplexed" as to why her film wasn't declared tax-free. She said 'Jhund' is also an important film and has a subject "that's crucial to our country's growth". 'Jhund', starring Amitabh Bachchan, released on March 4.

28.title: 23-yr-old man arrested for raping class 10 girl in Karnataka
28.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested by Karnataka's Annigeri Police on Friday for allegedly raping a class 10 girl. The accused took the minor to a field forcibly on his bike, raped her repeatedly and also threatened to kill her if she disclosed the matter to anybody, police said. Her parents, however, lodged a police complaint after learning about the crime.

29.title: Japan's PM arrives for 2-day visit, Railways Minister welcomes him
29.article_body: Japan's PM Fumio Kishida arrived in Delhi on Saturday for his two-day visit and was welcomed by Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He is scheduled to participate in the 14th India-Japan annual summit and hold bilateral talks with PM Narendra Modi. This is Kishida's first visit to India after taking office last year and his first meeting with PM Modi.

30.title: At least 12 migrants drown in shipwreck off Tunisia
30.article_body: At least 12 migrants, mostly Syrians, drowned in a shipwreck off Tunisia on Friday as they tried to cross the Mediterranean Sea to Italy, a civil protection official said. As per reports, several people have drowned off the Tunisian coast in recent months, with an increase in the frequency of attempted crossings to Europe from Tunisia and Libya towards Italy.

31.title: Mario Balotelli dropped from Italy squad for FIFA WC playoffs
31.article_body: Italian footballer Mario Balotelli was dropped from the country's squad for next week's FIFA World Cup playoff match. Earlier, Balotelli was recalled to the national team in January after almost three years. However, Luiz Felipe and Joao Pedro were included in the 33-member national squad. Italy will play against North Macedonia in a must-win game on March 25.

32.title: Rafael Nadal is like a computer, he can see through motion: Annacone
32.article_body: Tennis commentator Paul Annacone said Rafael Nadal's mind is like a computer, adding that he can "see through motion" on the tennis court to make good decisions which is tough. "It's been so much fun to watch Rafa [solve problems] and find...ways to get through matches," stated Annacone. Nadal recently recorded his 19th consecutive win in the ATP Tour season.

33.title: Nawab Malik will have to resign, divesting portfolio not enough: Fadnavis
33.article_body: NCP leader Nawab Malik will have to resign and divesting portfolio is not enough, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said. "We'll not relent until he resigns. His continuation in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government as a Cabinet minister is not only unethical but goes against the spirit of the Constitution," Fadnavis added. ED arrested Malik in a money laundering case.

34.title: Some films inspire change, Kashmir Files incites hate: Cong's Jairam
34.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday criticised the newly-released 'The Kashmir Files' and said that while some films inspire change, the Vivek Agnihotri directorial incites hate. "Truth can lead to justice, rehabilitation, reconciliation and peace. Propaganda twists facts, distorts history to whip up anger and promote violence," he tweeted. Several BJP members have lauded the movie.

35.title: Father, brother, grandfather, uncle rape 11-year-old girl over 5 years in Pune
35.article_body: Pune Police have booked an 11-year-old girl's father, brother, grandfather and uncle for allegedly raping and sexually assaulting her over the last five years. Her father allegedly raped her when they lived in Bihar in 2017 and she was later raped by her brother when she moved to Pune. Her grandfather and uncle sexually abused her last year, FIR stated.

36.title: Ferry firm that fired 800 workers on Zoom call can face unlimited fine: UK govt
36.article_body: UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng wrote to P&O Ferries, a shipping company that fired 800 employees over a three-minute Zoom call. Kwarteng said failure to give sufficient notice of large-scale redundancies, via the Insolvency Service and the Redundancy Payment Service, "is a criminal offence and can lead to an unlimited fine". Meanwhile, protests erupted against P&O Ferries across UK ports.

37.title: My first season in the IPL in 2019 with RCB was challenging: Hetmyer
37.article_body: Shimron Hetmyer admitted that IPL 2019 which marked his first season in the IPL, and saw him representing RCB was "challenging". "Being the only West Indian in the squad was tough," said Hetmyer. Hetmyer scored 90 runs in five matches in IPL 2019. He will represent RR in IPL 2022 having been signed for ₹8.50 crore in the mega auction.

38.title: Suzuki Motor to invest ₹9,569 cr for EV production in India: Report
38.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor plans to invest about ₹9,569 crore to produce electric vehicles and batteries in India, Reuters reported citing the Nikkei's report. Suzuki aims to build a new electric vehicle production line in India and start operations as early as 2025. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is visiting India on Saturday to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

39.title: NDRF personnel deployed in Andaman and Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
39.article_body: National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel have been deployed in Andaman and Nicobar Islands as IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. According to the administration, NDRF personnel are ready at different places with all necessary equipment to carry out search and rescue operations. "Fishermen are strongly advised not to venture into sea," the administration tweeted.

40.title: Varun to team up with Atlee for Hindi remake of South film: Reports
40.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan and filmmaker Atlee are reportedly teaming up for the Hindi remake of a South film. "There's a good chance that the film may be Vijay and Samantha starrer 'Theri'," reports stated. The original, which was released in 2016, was also helmed by Atlee. Meanwhile, the filmmaker is currently working on a film with Shah Rukh Khan.

41.title: An honour to play for India: Jhulan on becoming 2nd woman to play 200 ODIs
41.article_body: After she became the second woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs, following India captain Mithali Raj, pacer Jhulan Goswami said it's been an honour to play for India. The 39-year-old achieved this feat in India's match against Australia on Saturday in 2022 Women's World Cup. "It's been a pleasure, whenever I've worn this jersey. It's always been special," Jhulan added.

42.title: Pune's APMC seizes mangoes falsely being sold as Ratnagiri Alphonso
42.article_body: Pune's Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) has seized 42 boxes of mangoes being falsely sold as Alphonso mangoes from Ratnagiri by three wholesale dealers, an official said on Saturday. The seized mangoes had arrived from Karnataka, the official added. Alphonso mangoes from Karnataka are cheaper than the Ratnagiri Alphonso, a mango trader said.

43.title: Just imagine 14,000 dead bodies in that Russian stadium: Zelenskyy on Putin's speech
43.article_body: Commenting on Russian President Vladimir Putin's speech at a packed soccer stadium, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Just picture for yourself that in that stadium in Moscow there are 14,000 dead bodies...Those are the Russian costs throughout the invasion." Zelenskyy warned that Russia will lose in the long run if it doesn't end its war.

44.title: Profile of the world's most boring person released by researchers in the UK
44.article_body: British researchers have revealed the profile of the world's most boring person, based on a study on 500 people. The study summed up that the world's most boring person would be a data entry worker who's religious, lives in a town and whose favourite hobby is watching TV. Data analysis, accounting are among the most boring jobs, the study said.

45.title: Baltic countries expel 10 Russian diplomats amid Ukraine war
45.article_body: Latvia, Estonia, and Lithuania have expelled a total of 10 Russian diplomats amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, the foreign ministries of the three Baltic nations said. Lithuania has expelled four Russian diplomats, while Estonia and Latvia have expelled three each. "All ungrounded expulsions of Russian diplomats will be met with an appropriate answer," Russia's Foreign Ministry said.

46.title: Businessman to give away free gas worth $1 million as prices hit record high in US
46.article_body: US businessman Willie Wilson has announced that he would be giving away $1 million worth of gas free of cost to Cook County residents from March 24 as prices hit record high in the country. Earlier this week, several cars lined up at gas stations after he announced $200,000 worth of free gas at 10 stations in the city.

47.title: Elon Musk says first humans could land on Mars in 2029
47.article_body: SpaceX CEO in response to a Twitter user said the first humans could land on Mars in 2029. The user had posted a photo showing the 1969 Moon landing along with an image of people on Mars that read, "20_ _?" Last year, Musk had said, in a worst-case scenario, SpaceX would land humans on Mars in 10 years.

48.title: Organs of brain dead man give new lease of life to 6 patients in K'taka
48.article_body: Umesh B Dandagi (51), who was declared brain dead at KLES Hospital in Karnataka's Belagavi, gave new lease of life to six patients. His heart was transplanted to a patient in the same hospital. His kidneys were sent to their respective recipients through green corridor and liver was airlifted to Bengaluru. His corneas and skin were donated to respective banks.

49.title: Anushka Sharma steps away from her production house
49.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to announce she's stepping away from her production house Clean Slate Filmz (CSF) which she co-founded with her brother Karnesh. "Being a new mother who has chosen to be an actor by profession...I've decided...whatever time I've at hand...I'll dedicate it to my first love, acting!" she wrote. Clean Slate Filmz was founded in October 2013.

50.title: Camilla takes over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage
50.article_body: Prince Charles' wife Camilla has taken over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage. In a tweet, the National Theatre welcomed the Duchess of Cornwall as its Royal Patron. The move makes Camilla one of the first members of royal family to take up Meghan's former royal duties. Notably, National Theatre was among the four patronages passed on to Meghan in 2019.

51.title: 45-yr-old man thrashed to death after argument during Holi celebration
51.article_body: A 45-year-old man, Rajendra, was allegedly beaten to death on Friday following an argument during Holi celebration in Gurugram. After learning about his brother Sonu's clash with his brother-in-law Mithun, the deceased reportedly visited Mithun to sort the matter out where he was attacked with bricks and sticks. He was rushed to a hospital but doctors declared him brought dead.

52.title: Putin fired around 1,000 staff members fearing they would poison him: Report
52.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin allegedly fired about 1,000 personal staff members in February over fears that they would poison him, said a report. Citing a government source, the report said that those who were fired, included cooks, bodyguards, launderers, and secretaries. The report also said that in Russia, the preferred method of assassination is poisoning.

53.title: Every film has its own destiny: Pooja Hegde on mixed reviews for Radhe Shyam
53.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde while talking about receiving mixed reviews for her recently released film 'Radhe Shyam' said every film has its own destiny at the box office. "Sometimes you watch a film and you think it's an okay film but the box office does really well," she added. However, the actress said people praised her despite the film's overall performance.

54.title: 3 attack man with iron rod after he refused to give 'hafta' in Pune; held
54.article_body: Police have arrested three persons for attacking a man with an iron rod in Pune's Kondhwa. The victim alleged the accused told him that they were the goons of the area and he'll have to pay them regular protection money (hafta). However, when he rejected their demand, they attacked him and robbed him of his gold chain worth ₹1.05 lakh.

55.title: 72-yr-old auto-rickshaw driver held for molesting, kidnapping minor in Delhi
55.article_body: A 72-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly molesting and kidnapping an 11-year-old girl from Delhi's Bengali Market area on the Barakhamba Road. "The incident came to light on March 17 after the victim's parents...informed...their daughter had gone missing," police said. "The accused was trying to escape with the girl to Uttarakhand's Haridwar," police added.

56.title: 4,000 bikers penalised for not using a helmet on Holi in Mumbai
56.article_body: The Mumbai Police conducted a special drive on Holi and penalised 4,130 bikers for not using helmets. A total of 8,276 fines were issued from Thursday midnight to 7 pm on Friday. As per data, 1,876 fines were issued for violating parking norms, 110 were penalised for wrong side driving and 199 abandoned vehicles were cleared.

57.title: MI miscalculated, they'll surely miss Boult: Rajkumar ahead of IPL 2022
57.article_body: Rajkumar Sharma, childhood coach of Virat Kohli, said MI will miss pacer Trent Boult in upcoming IPL 2022 as he wasn't retained by them in mega auction last month. He added that the Mumbai-based franchise "miscalculated" before the auction. "To make up for Boult's absence, they went for Jaydev Unadkat," Rajkumar added. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore.

58.title: Will hold protests if railway concessions for senior citizens not restored: Pune Cong
58.article_body: Congress' Pune unit has warned the Centre that it will hold protests if concessions for senior citizens on railway tickets are not restored. Congress spokesperson Gopal Tiwari said concession helps senior citizens "in religious journeys and to visit other places". Tiwari added, "We condemn the decision of the Central government."

59.title: Ethereum's billionaire co-founder shares tweets trolling him for TIME cover
59.article_body: Vitalik Buterin, who co-founded the world's second-largest cryptocurrency Ethereum, on Saturday shared screenshots of tweets trolling him for his TIME magazine cover. The billionaire said, "The...tweets...are truly amazing. These are barely even cherry-picked...Highly recommend scrolling." The 28-year-old Russia-born Canadian is among the most influential people in the cryptocurrency world.

60.title: Hopeful CRPF won't be required soon in Northeast, J&K and Naxal-hit areas: Shah
60.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said he is hopeful that soon Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) won't be required in the Northeast, Jammu and Kashmir and Naxal-affected areas in the coming years. Shah added that the CRPF has played an indispensable role in maintaining internal security in these areas. Shah was addressing CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu.

61.title: Dalit man killed over his 'good looks, moustache', says family; Rajasthan police deny
61.article_body: The family of a Dalit man named Jitendrapal Meghwal, who was living in Rajasthan's Pali district, has alleged that he was killed because the accused were jealous of his moustache and good looks. While accused Suraj and Ramesh Singh have been arrested, police said the murder wasn't related to victim's looks but a mutual rivalry related to an old case.

62.title: People crushed by price rise; inflation a tax on all: Rahul Gandhi
62.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP-led Centre by tweeting that India's poor and middle-class were crushed by the "record price rise" even before the Ukraine war. Gandhi also added that "Inflation is a TAX on ALL Indians...GOI must act now" to protect the Indian citizens. His criticism comes days after Congress' debacle in the recent assembly elections.

63.title: Prostitution racket busted at OYO hotel in Delhi; 3 Uzbek women held
63.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday busted an international prostitution racket and arrested six people from an OYO hotel in Pandav Nagar, police said. After receiving information about the prostitution racket being run at the hotel, police carried out a raid on the hotel and arrested the accused, including three women from Uzbekistan. Police have now registered a case into the matter.

64.title: Morality is something: BJP on NCP not seeking Malik's resignation
64.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh has criticised NCP for not seeking the resignation of Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik. The BJP leader said, "Morality is something. It's a shame if a present minister... is in jail." He added that Malik's resignation should be taken for now and if the court finds him innocent then "he could be made minister again".

65.title: Pune-Solapur flyover likely to reopen tomorrow, to ease traffic congestion
65.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has planned to reopen the Pune-Solapur flyover at Hadapsar from tomorrow, easing traffic congestion. The flyover would resume traffic on one lane, Pune towards Solapur, for light-weight vehicles, however, heavy vehicles will be allowed after a month. The flyover was shut in February after local representatives complained of damage to a portion of the flyover.

66.title: 13-yr-old, mother die as SUV hits auto in Delhi; 21-yr-old driver held
66.article_body: Four of a family were severely injured, of whom a 13-year-boy and his mother died, after an SUV, being driven by a 21-year-old third-year college student, hit an auto-rickshaw on the Barapullah flyover on Friday. After hitting the auto-rickshaw, the accused also hit another car. Police said the accused has been arrested and an investigation is underway.

67.title: Morris Chestnut to be honoured with a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
67.article_body: Morris Chestnut, who starred in 'Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid', will be honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 53-year-old actor will be the 2,716th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "We're proud to welcome him to our famed Walk of Fame," said Ana Martinez, Producer of the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

68.title: Krunal will be laughing at me: Hardik on facing LSG in GT's IPL 2022 opener
68.article_body: GT skipper Hardik Pandya said his brother and LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya will be "laughing" at him when he walks out for his first toss, in GT's IPL 2022 opener against LSG. "Krunal...has never seen me [go for the toss]," added Hardik, revealing the reason behind his brother's reaction. GT will take on LSG on March 28 at Wankhede Stadium.

69.title: Universal Music label acquires Bored Ape NFT for $360,817
69.article_body: Universal Music Group has bought one of the Bored Apes NFTs for $360,817. The group has purchased Bored Ape #5537, a female character now known as Manager Noët All, which will lead its virtual NFT band, called Kingship, as the manager. Prior to the new joining, Kingship consisted of four digital characters, one mutant ape and three bored ape NFTs.

70.title: Don Young, longest-serving US congressman, passes away at 88
70.article_body: US Republican Representative Don Young, who was the longest-serving member of Congress, passed away at the age of 88 on Friday. The congressman died while travelling home to Alaska, his office said in a statement. "Don Young's legacy as a fighter for the state will live on, as will his fundamental goodness and honour. We'll miss him dearly," it added.

71.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases in India?
71.article_body: India currently has 27,802 active COVID-19 cases, with 15 states/UTs currently having more than 500 active COVID-19 cases. Kerala has the highest active COVID-19 cases at 7,289, followed by Maharashtra (5,684) and Mizoram (2,127). Karnataka has 2,055 active COVID-19 cases, while Assam and West Bengal also have more than 1,000 active COVID-19 cases.

72.title: Ukrainian bridal gown brand is now making military nets, vests for soldiers
72.article_body: A Ukrainian brand known for its wedding gowns is now also producing military nets and assault vests for the country's soldiers and medical workers amid the war with Russia. "Along with making brides around the globe happy, we are focused on saving our country," said Milla Nova's CEO Ulyana Kyrychuk. The CEO said they have already made 1,500 items.

73.title: TCS reappoints Rajesh Gopinathan as CEO and MD for five years
73.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reappointed Rajesh Gopinathan as its Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD) for five years. The company's board has also extended the term of Ganapathy Subramaniam as Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director to May 2024, as per its retirement age policy. Both Gopinathan and Subramaniam have held their respective positions since 2017.

74.title: Great Barrier Reef suffers severe coral bleaching due to high temperature
74.article_body: According to the Australian government agency, the Great Barrier Reef is suffering widespread and severe coral bleaching due to high ocean temperatures. "Bleaching has been detected across the Marine Park - it's widespread but variable, across multiple regions, ranging in impact from minor to severe," the authority added. The bleaching that occurred two years back damaged two-thirds of the coral.

75.title: 4-yr UG programmes to start at Pune university from academic year 2022-23
75.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) is going to introduce four-year undergraduate programmes from the academic year 2022-23. The University Grants Commission (UGC) had released draft guidelines on four-year UG programmes, which was proposed in the National Education Policy. SPPU VC said the new programme will help students in research and further studies, while also pursuing a PhD.

76.title: Demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help Kashmiri Pandits: Tharoor
76.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday, while sharing a Facebook post about Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' on Twitter, said, "Kashmiri Pandits suffered terribly...But demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help the Pandits either." "Hatred divides and kills. Kashmiris need justice. All need to be heard, helped and healed," Tharoor added.

77.title: Russia to work on its own Mars mission after Europe suspends project: Report
77.article_body: Russia will start working on its own Mars mission after Europe's ESA announced the suspension of a joint project following the Ukraine invasion, the Interfax news agency reported. The ESA had said it would be impossible to continue cooperating with Russia on the ExoMars mission. Roscosmos head said there were "big doubts" about what the ESA could do without Russia.

78.title: Smoke from wildfires destroys ozone layer: Study
78.article_body: Smoke from wildfires can destroy the ozone layer, a study by the University of Waterloo has found. "The Australian fires injected acidic smoke particles into the stratosphere, disrupting the chlorine, hydrogen and nitrogen chemistry that regulate ozone," the lead author of the study said. The smoke converts these ozone-regulating compounds into more reactive compounds that destroy ozone, he added.

79.title: Australia record highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history, defeat India
79.article_body: Australia chased down a 278-run target against India on Saturday to record the highest successful run chase in Women's World Cup history. The previous highest successful run chase in Women's World Cups had come in 2017, when Australia chased down a 258-run target against Sri Lanka. Australia have won each of their five 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

80.title: Ukraine temporarily lost access to Sea of Azov: Defence Ministry
80.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said it had "temporarily" lost access to the Sea of Azov. The ministry didn't specify whether Ukraine had regained access to the sea, but said that Russian forces had been pushed back from approaches toward the southern city of Mykolaiv. Russia on Friday had said it was "tightening the noose" around the besieged port city of Mariupol.

81.title: Won't see a young player as good as Shaw in my life: PBKS batting consultant
81.article_body: Sharing his experience on watching Prithvi Shaw bat when he was eight years old, PBKS' batting consultant Julian Wood said he will never see a young player as good as Shaw again in his life. "I have never seen a boy that young technically so sound," added Wood. "He hit the ball very hard for someone so small," stated Wood.

82.title: Satellite pics show destruction in Ukraine's Mariupol after Russian bombing
82.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share satellite pictures showing destruction in Ukraine's Mariupol after Russian attack. "This is Mariupol, showing devastation to residential homes, apartment buildings and stores in north and west of the port city in Ukraine," it wrote. Russia also destroyed a theatre sheltering civilians in the city.

83.title: England in danger for too much reliance on Root, Stokes: Nick Compton
83.article_body: Ex-England batter Nick Compton said England have been in danger for being too reliant on Joe Root and Ben Stokes for a while. Root and Stokes scored 153 and 120 respectively in the first innings of England's Barbados Test against West Indies. Dan Lawrence was the next top run-getter with 91 runs as England declared having scored 507 runs.

84.title: Taliban frees journalists detained over report on TV show censoring
84.article_body: The Taliban have released three employees of Afghanistan's largest television station, TOLONews, for allegedly reporting on the Taliban government's decision to ban the broadcast of foreign TV series in the country. The UN and press freedom organisations had condemned the journalists' arrest. Reportedly, over 230 media outlets have shut down in Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power in August.

85.title: Russia uses Kinzhal hypersonic missiles in Ukraine
85.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that the country used hypersonic Kinzhal missiles in Ukraine, according to an Interfax report. "The Kinzhal aviation missile system with hypersonic aeroballistic missiles destroyed a large underground warehouse containing missiles and aviation ammunition in the village of Deliatyn in the Ivano-Frankivsk region," the ministry added.

86.title: 'The Kashmir Files' earns ₹19.15 cr on day 8, more than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'
86.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark in India. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri directorial earned more money on day eight than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'. "#TheKashmirFiles creates history. Day 8 of The Kashmir Files [₹19.15 cr] is AT PAR with #Baahubali2 [₹19.75 cr] and higher than #Dangal [₹18.59 cr]," he tweeted.

87.title: 'The Batman' actor Paul Dano to write comic book about Riddler
87.article_body: Actor Paul Dano, who played The Riddler in Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman', is writing a comic exploring the origins of the supervillain. Titled 'Riddler: Year One', the comic will launch in stores in October, DC shared on Twitter. 'The Batman', directed by Matt Reeves, has earned more than $500 million at the worldwide box office.

88.title: It's a sweet story: Shreyas on his next directorial 'Sar Car Ki Seva Mei'
88.article_body: Shreyas Talpade, who's currently working on his second directorial, tentatively titled 'Sar Car Ki Seva Mei', spoke about the upcoming film in an interview. Describing the film as a "sweet little story", he said it's about a man whose car gets stolen and what he does to get it back. "I play that part...and direct it as well," Shreyas said.

89.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest 11 people for gambling
89.article_body: Hyderabad's Trimulgherry Police on Friday arrested 11 people for gambling. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided a house in Saraswathi Nagar and arrested the accused. The police also seized ₹11,600 cash, 10 cell phones and playing cards from the accused. According to police, prime accused S Satyanarayana had been previously involved in similar offences in the city.

90.title: Cong names Ripun Bora, Jeby Mather as RS candidates from Assam, Kerala
90.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Ripun Bora and Kerala Pradesh Mahila Congress President Jeby Mather have been named as the Congress candidates for the biennial elections to Rajya Sabha from Assam and Kerala respectively. Bora was first elected to the Upper House in March 2016 while Mather has never been elected yet. The candidatures were approved by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

91.title: 65-yr-old man killed in Guj as two groups clash over playing cricket match
91.article_body: A 65-year-old man was killed when two communities clashed over playing a cricket match in  Sandalpur village of Gujarat's Navsari district. The incident occurred on Friday after an argument broke out between the groups and people attacked each other with deadly weapons. According to Navsari DSP, a case was registered against 32 people following cross FIRs from both sides.

92.title: Google accused of systemic bias against Black employees
92.article_body: Google has been accused of systemic racial bias against Black employees, claiming it drives them towards lower-level jobs, pays them less and denies them opportunities. The lawsuit said Google maintains a "racially biased corporate culture" that favours white men, with Black people comprising only 4.4% of employees. It allegedly also subjected Black employees to a hostile work environment.

93.title: Indrani Mukerjea gets bail in 2017 Byculla jail rioting case
93.article_body: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea has been granted bail in connection to a case lodged following rioting in Byculla jail in 2017. The accused, including Indrani and over 30 inmates, had caused damage to prison property as well as injured six prison guards during the rioting. Indrani is also accused of killing her daughter Sheena Bora in 2012.

94.title: Infant killed, 3 injured as SUV with TRS MLA's sticker hits street vendors in Hyd
94.article_body: A two-month-old child died and three others were injured when a speeding SUV, with a temporary registration number, hit street vendors in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills. The vehicle had a sticker in the name of Bodhan TRS MLA Mohammed Shakil Aamir. Aamir has reportedly claimed that he had nothing to do with the incident and that it was his cousin's vehicle.

95.title: Ex-US Presidents visit Ukrainian Church to show support for Kyiv
95.article_body: Ex-US Presidents Bill Clinton and George W Bush visited a Ukrainian church in Chicago in a show of solidarity for the country amid Russian invasion. They laid sunflowers wrapped with blue and yellow ribbons at the Saints Volodymyr and Olha Catholic Church. "America stands united with the people of Ukraine in their fight for freedom and against oppression," Clinton said.

96.title: TN to allot ₹1,000 to girls in govt schools monthly to pursue higher education
96.article_body: Tamil Nadu government will provide ₹1,000 monthly assistance to all girl students studying in classes 6 to 12 in government schools to encourage them to pursue higher education. The amount will be transferred into their bank accounts till completion of their undergraduate degree, diploma and ITI courses. The scheme will benefit approximately six lakh girls in the state, government said.

97.title: Priyanka, Nick share pics and videos from Holi bash at their LA home
97.article_body: Priyanka Chopra and her husband Nick Jonas have shared pictures and videos from the Holi bash at their home in Los Angeles. Nick's brother Kevin Jonas and youngest sibling Franklin Jonas also joined them for the party. "Thank you to our friends and family for playing holi like desi's do! Feeling blessed," Priyanka wrote on Instagram.

98.title: Amit Shah attends CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu, presents awards
98.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah attended CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu on Saturday. Shah also presented awards and medals to CRPF personnel and families of soldiers who lost their lives while fighting terrorism and insurgency across the country. Notably, this is the first time that CRPF is celebrating the event outside the national capital.

99.title: My wife refused to come for 2011 WC final, she still gets embarrassed about it: Gambhir
99.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has revealed that his wife Natasha refused to come for the 2011 World Cup final in Mumbai. "She said 'Is it that important? It's just another game of cricket. Who will bother travelling to Mumbai? My sister and brother will come'," Gambhir said. Gambhir further said that she still gets embarrassed about rejecting the offer.

100.title: Boy who escaped Ukraine with phone number written on hand reunites with mother
100.article_body: An 11-year-old Ukrainian boy, who travelled 1,000 km alone to reach Slovakia amid the war, has been reunited with his mother. Hassan Pisecká escaped Ukraine with only a plastic bag, passport, and telephone number scribbled on his hand. "I'd like to thank everyone from my heart. We lost everything we've had but we're healthy," his mother said.

101.title: Brazil blocks Telegram over non-compliance, CEO apologises
101.article_body: Brazilian Supreme Court has ordered the suspension of Telegram for failing to freeze accounts spreading disinformation or comply with the country's laws. Telegram CEO Pavel Durov apologized for the company's "negligence" and asked the court to delay its ruling for a few days. Apple and Google have been asked to help block their users from being able to use Telegram.

102.title: It will take years to defuse unexploded Russian mines: Ukraine
102.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Minister Denys Monastyrsky said that it'll "take years" to defuse unexploded Russian shells and mines. Ukraine will need support from the West to cope with the task once the war is over, he added. In addition to the unexploded Russian ordnances, Ukrainian forces have planted land mines at bridges, airports, and other key infrastructure to deter Russian use.

103.title: Man shot dead by neighbour during Holi celebrations in Kolkata
103.article_body: A man, identified as Dilip Chauhan, was shot dead by his neighbour during Holi celebrations following a heated argument in Kolkata, police said. The deceased was a peanut seller and accused used to work in a fish market, police added. "Around 3:00 pm we heard the sound of gunfire...We found that Chauhan had been shot," a local resident said.

104.title: Mumbai woman constable's husband shares obscene pics of her online, held
104.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly circulating obscene pictures of his 27-year-old wife, who is a woman police constable in Mumbai, on social media, police said. A police officer at the Marine Drive police station said the accused, who lives in Pune, had a dispute with his wife, which could be the reason why he circulated the photographs online.

105.title: Police arrest 2 men for stealing scooters in Thane
105.article_body: Police have arrested two persons in Thane on Friday for allegedly stealing scooters in the city. Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap for the accused who were coming to Shastri Nagar to sell the stolen scooters at half of their price. Seven scooters stolen between 2018 and 2021 were also recovered from them.

106.title: Sunny Deol celebrates Holi on sets of 'Gadar 2', shares video
106.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol on Friday celebrated Holi with the cast and crew of his film, 'Gadar 2'. Taking to Instagram, he shared a video where he can be seen applying gulal to the film's director Anil Sharma and his son, actor Utkarsh Sharma. "#HappyHoli everyone," Sunny wrote. Utkarsh will play the role of Sunny's son in the upcoming film.

107.title: 2 drown while taking bath in Odisha river after celebrating Holi; 4 others missing
107.article_body: Two youths drowned and four others went missing while bathing in Kharasrota river in a village in Odisha's Jajpur, officials said. Seven youths had gone to the river to take a bath after celebrating Holi when they were swept away in the strong current of the river, the village sarpanch said. One of them was rescued and rushed to hospital.

108.title: Raina is a legend but was perhaps not suited for IPL 2022: RR's Sangakkara
108.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said Suresh Raina is an "absolute legend" but was perhaps "not suited" for the upcoming IPL 2022, having gone unsold in IPL mega auction. Raina has scored 5,528 runs in 205 IPL matches so far having represented CSK and now-defunct franchise Gujarat Lions. He scored 160 runs in 12 IPL 2021 matches for CSK.

109.title: 10 MLAs sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet
109.article_body: Ten MLAs were sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet after they took oath on Saturday at Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh. The ceremony began with Harpal Singh Cheema, a second time MLA from Dirba, taking the oath. Aam Aadmi Party announced Kultar Singh Sandhwan, a two-time MLA from Kotkapura, as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Vidhan Sabha.

110.title: 3 Russian cosmonauts wear colours of Ukrainian flag as they arrive on space station
110.article_body: Three Russian cosmonauts arrived at the International Space Station (ISS) wearing yellow flight suits with blue accents, colours that match the flag of Ukraine. “It became our turn to pick a colour. But, in fact, we had accumulated a lot of yellow material so we needed to use it," one of the cosmonauts said about the colour of their suits.

111.title: Will donate his body for research: Father of Indian student killed in Ukraine
111.article_body: The father of Indian student Naveen Shekarappa Gyanagoudar who was killed in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv has decided to donate his son's body for medical research. "My son wanted to achieve something in the medical field, that didn't happen. At least his body can be used by other medical students for studies," his father added.

112.title: 8 killed, over 25 injured as private bus overturns in Karnataka
112.article_body: At least eight persons died after the private bus they were travelling in overturned in the Tumakuru district of Karnataka on Saturday. Police said that more than 25 persons sustained injuries in the accident. Initial investigations suggest that the bus, which was carrying 60 passengers, toppled after the driver lost control over the vehicle, police added.

113.title: Biden talks to China's Xi for nearly 2 hours as they discuss Ukraine war
113.article_body: US President Joe Biden talked to Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping for nearly two hours as the leaders discussed the war in Ukraine. Xi said China and US should "shoulder international responsibilities". The White House said, "President Biden described the implications and consequences if China provides material support to Russia as it conducts brutal attacks against Ukrainian cities and civilians."

114.title: Zostel could be entitled to 7% stake in IPO-bound OYO: HC bench
114.article_body: A Delhi High Court division bench has said Zostel will be entitled to 7% stake in IPO-bound OYO, if it eventually wins its claim, or be paid the value of its shareholding. As per the order, the two parties are also open to a consensual order. Zostel has been engaged in a court battle with OYO over a failed merger.

115.title: Elgar Parishad accused activist alleges tampering with COVID certificate
115.article_body: Activist Arun Ferreira, an Elgar Parishad case accused, alleged his COVID-19 vaccination certificate was tampered with and sought a probe into the same. He claimed that the certificate given to him was different from the one accessed by his family. The applicant's name, age and other details were incorrectly mentioned in the certificate provided by the prison, Ferreira's plea states.

116.title: BMC to add over 100 COVID-19 vaccination centres for 12-15 age group
116.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will increase the number of COVID-19 vaccination centres from 12 to 100-150 for children aged between 12-15 years. According to BMC, there are around four lakh children within the age group. However, there has been a low turnout in the vaccination due to the exam season, a BMC official said.

117.title: Youth beaten, booked for allegedly propagating Christianity in Karnataka
117.article_body: A youth was beaten up by right-wing activists for allegedly propagating Christianity outside a college in Hassan, Karnataka. A right-wing outfit, Bajarangi Hindu Parishat, lodged a police complaint that booked him and his wife under section 295 A of the IPC for outraging religious feelings. The outfit accused youth of luring college students to embrace the Christian faith.

118.title: Syrian Prez visits UAE, 1st trip to Arab state since war began in 2011
118.article_body: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad arrived in the UAE on Friday, his first trip to an Arab state since the Syrian war began in 2011. Assad met Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, who expressed willingness to strengthen ties with Syria again, Emirati state media reported. The Arab League had expelled Syria after the war broke out.

119.title: Man stabs self to death while dancing at Holika Dahan celebrations in MP
119.article_body: A man succumbed to knife injuries while celebrating Holika Dahan in the Banganga area of Madhya Pradesh, according to police. The incident took place when the man was dancing, along with other people, with a knife in his hand. The man allegedly stabbed himself, police said, adding that a case has been registered in this connection.

120.title: Man dies after falling from building while fighting over drugs in Mumbai
120.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after falling from the fourth floor of a building in Mumbai. According to police, victim Aftab Shaikh was consuming drugs with Sultan Khan on the terrace of a building in Kurla. However, both fell while fighting after Khan accused Shaikh of consuming more marijuana. The victim died on spot while Khan suffered minor injuries.

121.title: Sanjay & I are shocked beyond words: Torbaaz producer on Girish's son's death
121.article_body: Rahul Mittra, who bankrolled Girish Malik's directorial 'Torbaaz', has condoled the demise of Girish's son Mannan, who passed away after falling from the fifth floor of his building in Mumbai's Andheri on Friday. "I am non-plussed to learn about the unfortunate incident," he said. Rahul added that Sanjay Dutt is "deeply saddened too". "We are shocked beyond words," Rahul said.

122.title: Catholic body urges Guj CM to include all holy books in school curriculum
122.article_body: The Gujarat Education Board of Catholic Institutions (GEBCI) has written to Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel, requesting the state government to include the principles of all holy books in the school curriculum. This comes after the state government announced on Thursday that Bhagavad Gita will be a part of the school syllabus for classes 6-12 from the academic year 2022-23.

123.title: Glenn Maxwell marries his Indian fiancée Vini Raman, shares pic
123.article_body: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell got married to his Indian fiancée Vini Raman, who is a Melbourne-based pharmacist. The couple took to Instagram to share a picture from their Christian wedding ceremony, writing, "Mr and Mrs Maxwell 18.03.22." They had been dating for around four years. On March 27, the couple will get married in a traditional ceremony with Tamil-Brahmin customs.

124.title: Mithali Raj equals record for registering most 50-plus scores in Women's World Cups
124.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj has equalled the record for registering most 50-plus scores in Women's World Cups. Mithali scored 68 runs off 96 deliveries against Australia today, which is her 12th 50-plus score in Women's World Cups. She equalled the record of former New Zealand cricketer Debbie Hockley. Notably, Mithali is featuring in her sixth Women's World Cup.

125.title: Viral pic shows 'Grandson of MLA' written on number plate of man's bike in TN
125.article_body: A viral picture shows 'Grandson of Nagercoil MLA Shri MR Gandhi' written on the number plate of a man's bike in Tamil Nadu. Several social media users criticised the man, with many saying that Gandhi, who is a senior BJP leader, is unmarried. Users also said that Gandhi is a simple man who goes to the state Assembly without footwear.

126.title: NSG head constable dies by suicide in Haryana’s Manesar: Police
126.article_body: A head constable of the National Security Guard (NSG) allegedly died by suicide at the NSG camp in Haryana's Manesar on Friday, police said. The reason that led the deceased to take such an extreme step is, however, not yet certain. His wife is in a state of shock and is being treated in a hospital, police added.

127.title: India's Pooja Vastrakar smashes the biggest six of 2022 Women's World Cup so far
127.article_body: India's Pooja Vastrakar smashed the biggest six of 2022 Women's World Cup after hitting an 81-metre maximum on the bowling of Australia's Megan Schutt on Saturday. She overtook South Africa's Chloe Tryon and compatriot Smriti Mandhana, who had slammed 80-metre sixes. Vastrakar scored 34 runs off 28 deliveries against Australia.

128.title: Man killed after fight at shop near PVR Naraina in Delhi, 5 apprehended
128.article_body: Five people were apprehended for allegedly killing a man following a heated argument at a paan shop near PVR Naraina on Friday night, Delhi Police said. The victim was a 27-year-old man who was a resident of Naraina. A fight broke out after the vehicle of the deceased hit an employee of the paan shop, police added.

129.title: Kapil Sharma's fan shares his look from Nandita Das' film, he reacts
129.article_body: A fan of Kapil Sharma shared a picture of the comedian-actor on Twitter, revealing his look from Nandita Das' film. In the picture, he can be seen carrying a delivery bag on his back. "Today I saw you in person," the fan wrote. Kapil, who'll portray a food delivery rider in the film, responded, "Don't tell anyone else about it."

130.title: Kerala HC acquits ex-minister MM Mani in Anchery Baby murder case
130.article_body: Kerala High Court on Friday acquitted former Kerala Minister and CPI(M) leader MM Mani and two others accused in the Anchery Baby murder case. Anchery Baby, a Youth Congress leader, was shot dead on November 13, 1982, in Idukki. The case was reopened after Mani had said in May 2012 that three persons who had opposed the party were killed.

131.title: Google's undersea cable lands in Togo, to 'double' internet speed
131.article_body: A Google-owned subsea cable, the Equiano cable, that aims to "double" the internet speed for millions in Africa arrived in Togo on Friday. It will also make landings in Nigeria, Namibia and South Africa, with possible branches offering connections to nearby countries. It is expected to start operating by the end of the year.

132.title: 17-yr-old drowns after slipping into 25-ft pond while taking selfie in Gurugram
132.article_body: A 17-year-old boy drowned while trying to take a selfie by standing at the edge of a 25-foot-deep pond in Gurugram. Police said the boy and his two friends posed for a selfie after forming a chain by holding hands. After two of them slipped and fell, the third person jumped into water and managed to save one of them.

133.title: US military plane with 4 onboard crashes during NATO exercise
133.article_body: A US military plane with four people onboard crashed in northern Norway while taking part in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) drills, Norwegian officials said. Reportedly, the Marine MV-22 Osprey, belonging to the US Marine Corps, lost contact with ground support due to bad weather. Currently, there are about 3,000 US Marines in Norway for a NATO training exercise.

134.title: India reports 2,075 COVID-19 cases, 71 deaths in last 24 hours
134.article_body: India has reported 2,075 new COVID-19 cases, 3,383 recoveries, and 71 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,528 cases and 149 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,352, while the active caseload declined to 27,802.

135.title: 4 workers from Bengal killed, 1 missing as land caves in at Kerala construction site
135.article_body: Four workers from West Bengal died, two sustained injuries and another went missing after the land caved in at a construction site inside Electronic City in Kerala's Kochi, police said. The incident took place when they were digging land to lay pillars. Some local residents claimed that work was going on without local body's permission and without enough safety measures.

136.title: 23-yr-old who went to take bath in U'khand's Bhagirathi river goes missing
136.article_body: A 23-year-old man, who went to take bath in the Bhagirathi river with his friends after Holi celebrations on Friday in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi has gone missing. The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) team along with State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) launched a rescue operation to locate the youth, but no trace of him was found until late evening.

137.title: Drunken man attacks traffic constable with stone in Thane; arrested
137.article_body: An on-duty traffic constable was attacked with stone by drunken men at Kapurbawdi in Thane. The 56-year-old constable had levied a fine on a bike rider in a drink-and-drive case on Friday evening. His pillion rider returned after 15 minutes to take revenge from the constable and attacked him with a big stone. He has been arrested.

138.title: LG suspends all shipments to Russia amid war with Ukraine
138.article_body: South Korean multinational conglomerate LG Electronics has announced that it's suspending all shipments to Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. LG added that it will continue to keep a close watch on the situation as it unfolds. "We are deeply concerned for the health and safety of all people, and LG remains committed to supporting humanitarian relief efforts," LG stated.

139.title: Putin's speech justifying Ukraine invasion cut midway due to technical glitch
139.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin justified the invasion of Ukraine before a packed soccer stadium on Friday. The coverage of his speech on state television was unexpectedly interrupted by what Russia said was a technical problem with a server. Soon afterwards, Putin's speech, which lasted about five minutes, was re-aired from the start.

140.title: It is b******t, it is crap: Gambhir on people thinking he doesn't like MS Dhoni
140.article_body: On being asked about people thinking he doesn't like MS Dhoni, Gautam Gambhir said, "It's b******t. It's crap." "I've so much of mutual respect for him," he added. He further said, "I hope he's never in need...but if he's ever in need in life...I'll be the first one standing next to him because of what he's done for Indian cricket."

141.title: 22-year-old man murdered by lover's family in Pune, four arrested
141.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly killed by the family members of his lover in Pune. Four people have been arrested till now and the initial investigation reveals that the girl's family was against the affair between the two, police said. "Pradhunya Kamble was murdered...on Wednesday in Dangat Patil Industrial Estate," Shankar Khatke, inspector at the Warje Police Station, said.

142.title: China reports first COVID-19 deaths in more than a year
142.article_body: China's national health authorities reported two COVID-19 deaths on Saturday, the first recorded rise in the death toll since January 2021. The deaths were reported from Jilin province, which has instituted a travel ban, with people needing permission from police to travel across borders. China reported 2,157 new COVID-19 cases from community transmission on Saturday, with the majority in Jilin.

143.title: India backs ban on biological weapons at UN Security Council
143.article_body: At the UN Security Council, India backed a convention prohibiting biological weapons. "India attaches high importance to Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention as a key global and non-discriminatory disarmament Convention," India's Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador R Ravindra said. He added it's important to ensure effective implementation of the BTWC in letter and spirit.

144.title: Tamil Nadu govt to bear cost of govt school students who get into IITs, IIMs
144.article_body: While presenting Budget 2022-23, Tamil Nadu Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan announced the state government will bear the cost of undergraduate education of students who get into IITs, IIMs and other premier institutions. Those who studied in government schools from classes 6-12 will be eligible. Rajan proposed a monthly stipend of ₹1,000 for government school girl students pursuing higher studies.

145.title: Feeder bus service at metro stations in Pune to begin from March 21
145.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is going to start feeder bus service at metro stations in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad from March 21. "Initially, we have kept 20 rounds of frequency daily. Depending on the response, we will increase the frequency," PMPML Traffic Manager said. "The routes are around 8-10 kilometres as per passengers' demands," he added.

146.title: Improper handling of Taiwan issues will hit China-US ties: Xi to Biden
146.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping told US President Joe Biden on Friday, "If the Taiwan issue is not handled properly, it'll have a subversive impact on the relationship between the two countries." "Some individuals in...US are sending...wrong signals to pro-independence forces in Taiwan, and that's very dangerous," Xi told Biden on a video call. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

147.title: Lock Upp's Sara Khan reveals ex-husband cheated on her with a spa worker
147.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Sara Khan revealed that her ex-husband, Ali Mercchant, cheated on her with a woman who used to work at her spa in Mumbai. "I'd a spa...He was also involved in it...There was this assistant manager he appointed...I got to know about them...That's when I thought, with my workers? This is extreme...I thought that was it," she added.

148.title: Rachakonda Police arrest man for blackmailing woman with bathing video
148.article_body: The Rachakonda Police arrested a 21-year-old man for allegedly blackmailing and harassing a woman on social media. According to police, the accused, a resident of Kataram village in Bhupalpally district, is a close relative of the victim. However, he allegedly recorded a video of the victim while bathing and used it to seek sexual favours from her, police said.

149.title: 19-yr-old's body found in pond in Gurugram, friends booked for murder
149.article_body: A 19-year-old man's body was found in a pond in Gurugram's Palra village on Friday morning. Police have booked at least eight men, including the victim's friends, on charges of murder after his father's complaint. The incident took place when the victim had gone to a percolation pond for a bath with a group of friends, police said.

150.title: Biden nominates Indian-American Puneet Talwar as US envoy to Morocco
150.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-American Puneet Talwar to serve as Ambassador to Morocco, the White House announced on Friday. "Talwar has held senior national security and foreign policy positions in the State Department, White House, and the United States Senate," the White House said. He is currently a Senior Advisor at the US State Department.

151.title: GM buys SoftBank's stake in self-driving unit Cruise for $2.1 bn
151.article_body: General Motors has agreed to buy SoftBank Vision Fund 1's stake in its self-driving startup Cruise for $2.1 billion. It will also make a separate $1.35 billion investment in the unit that SoftBank had committed to make in 2018. The transactions will push GM's total ownership in the unit to 80%. Other remaining shareholders in Cruise include Microsoft and Honda.

152.title: Dog kennel, motor transport office inaugurated at Hyderabad CAR HQ
152.article_body: A dog kennel and a motor transport office were inaugurated at the City Armed Reserve (CAR) headquarters in Hyderabad's Amberpet on Thursday. A number of refresher courses were also organised for the personnel as part of the 15-day demobilisation camp. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat who inaugurated the facilities lauded the services of the teams as "highly commendable".

153.title: I was struck in the head by a man, this s**t needs to stop: Actress Karen Fukuhara
153.article_body: Actress Karen Fukuhara, best known for playing Kimiko Miyashiro in 'The Boys' and Katana in 'Suicide Squad', took to Instagram to reveal that she "was struck in the head by a man". She accompanied the post with the hashtag "Stop Asian Hate". "This s**t needs to stop. Us women, Asians, the elderly need your help," she wrote.

154.title: Bangladesh win an ODI in South Africa for the first time in history
154.article_body: Bangladesh defeated South Africa by 38 runs in Centurion to register their first-ever ODI victory on South African soil. Prior to the match, Bangladesh had played 14 ODIs in South Africa, out of which they had lost 13, while one match had produced no result. Bangladesh scored 314/7 in the match, their highest-ever ODI total in South Africa.

155.title: 8-yr-old playing Holi on road dies, 3 injured after being hit by car in Mumbai
155.article_body: The driver of a private cab hit an eight-year-old boy while he was playing Holi in Mumbai's Bandra, killing him, and later hit and injured three other persons, who were on a morning walk. He was apprehended by local residents and handed over to the police. The driver reportedly told police he had mistakenly hit the accelerator, instead of brakes.

156.title: Ukrainian ballet star Artyom Datsishin dies from Russian shelling injuries
156.article_body: Ukrainian ballet star Artyom Datsishin passed away on Thursday from wounds he suffered in Russian shelling weeks earlier. Datsishin was a principal dancer with the National Opera of Ukraine. Earlier, Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets was killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv.

157.title: 13-year-old boy killed, 4 injured after car hits autorickshaw in Delhi
157.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was killed and four others were injured after a car hit an autorickshaw on the Barapullah flyover in Delhi on Friday, police said. The autorickshaw driver and four members of a family were injured in the accident, police added. One of the injured family members was declared brought dead to the AIIMS Trauma Centre.

158.title: Indian firms may replace Western pharma companies leaving Russian market: Russia
158.article_body: Indian firms may replace Western pharmaceutical companies leaving the Russian market over Ukraine war, Russian envoy to India Denis Alipov told the Rossiya 24 broadcaster. The newly appointed Russian envoy added that India is a "world pharmacy". Earlier this month, Alipov had said that Moscow welcomed the independent foreign policy of India amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

159.title: Fortunes of US oil tycoons jump 10% to $239 billion amid Russia-Ukraine war
159.article_body: The collective net worth of American oil and gas industrialists jumped nearly 10% to $239 billion since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Harold Hamm, the Co-founder of Continental Resources, moved up 28 places on Bloomberg's list of world's 500 richest people with $18.6 billion fortune. Meanwhile, Freeport LNG's Founder Michael Smith entered the list for the very first time.

160.title: Biden, Xi discuss Russia-Ukraine conflict in 2-hour-long video call
160.article_body: US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday discussed the Russia-Ukraine conflict for nearly two hours on a video call. Xi told Biden that conflicts and confrontations were in no-one's interests, according to a Chinese foreign ministry statement. The US has sought to deter China from providing military or economic assistance for Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

161.title: LeT module busted in J&K’s Pulwama, 6 alleged militants arrested
161.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Friday arrested six alleged militants after busting a module of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in Pulwama district. "Preliminary probe revealed they were involved in providing logistics, shelter and motivating youth to act as hybrid terrorists," police said. The investigating team also learnt they were working for Reyaz Ahmad Dar alias Sheeraz of LeT, a spokesman said.

162.title: Partially eaten body of missing man found in jungles of UP's Kanpur
162.article_body: A 32-year-old labourer who went missing after leaving home for work on Wednesday has been found dead in jungles of Nirala Nagar railway ground in UP's Kanpur, with his body partially eaten by animals. The police also recovered a blood-stained brick along with a pair of slippers and handkerchief from near the body. His body has been sent for post-mortem.

163.title: Russia & Canada argue on Twitter over 'kindergarten-level' UN letter edits
163.article_body: A Russian envoy engaged in an argument with the Canadian mission to the United Nations, after the latter made several changes to a letter sent by Russia on providing aid access and civilian protection in Ukraine amid the war. Reacting to it, the Russian envoy said, "Thank you...for this kindergarten-level Russophobic libel!...It...shows that your...good manners are at lowest ebb."

164.title: 900 trees likely to be cut to widen 5 km road in MP's Indore
164.article_body: Around 900 trees have been identified for felling to facilitate the widening of a 5 km stretch on road in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, civic official Chetan Patil said, adding that only 10% of the trees would be transplanted. Trees such as neem and peepal would be uprooted by machines and transplanted using a special technique, he further said.

165.title: Presence of anthrax found in dead deer at IIT Madras campus
165.article_body: At least four deer deaths were recorded in IIT Madras campus in the last two days with testing "revealing the presence of anthrax" in one case, the institute said. According to National Health Portal, anthrax is an infectious zoonotic disease, meaning it can spread from animals to humans. Wildlife personnel who handled carcass will be administered antibiotics, the institute added.

166.title: High energy costs amid Ukraine conflict trigger protests in Europe
166.article_body: High energy costs due to Russia-Ukraine conflict have led to protests by farmers in France and Greece, while truckers in Spain have gone on strike. Notably, a substantial part of the oil and natural gas supply to Europe comes from Russia. Reportedly, the war worsened an energy supply crunch that has driven up costs for households and businesses for months.

167.title: Federer to donate $500,000 to support Ukrainian children’s education
167.article_body: Roger Federer on Friday said he will donate $500,000 through his foundation "to establish access to continued schooling for Ukrainian children" affected by Russia's invasion. "My family and I are horrified seeing pictures from Ukraine and heartbroken for the innocent people who have been so terribly affected. We stand for peace," he said. Federer is a 20-time Grand Slam champion.

168.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Diamond League
168.article_body: Premier track and field competition Diamond League has excluded Russian Authorised Neutral Athletes (ANA) and Belarusian athletes from its events "for the foreseeable future", organisers said. The decision has been taken following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The Wanda Diamond League meetings accepted the recommendation of the board to exclude the respective athletes," organisers said.

169.title: He’s my idol since I was a kid: 18-year-old Alcaraz on Rafael Nadal
169.article_body: World number 19 Carlos Alcaraz on Saturday will play against his idol Rafael Nadal in the semi-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. The 18-year-old beat defending champion Cameron Norrie 6-4, 6-3 to reach the semi-finals. "It's amazing to play against Rafa," Alcaraz said. "I think it's going to be a great match," he added.

170.title: Practised against tape-ball: Rizwan on preparations before Karachi Test
170.article_body: Muhammad Rizwan, who scored 104* in fourth innings of drawn second Pakistan-Australia Test, revealed how he prepared with "different drills" before Karachi Test. "I asked Iftikhar Ahmed in...nets to use tape-ball and bowl from angles like Pat Cummins did. Then...asked Zahid Mahmood [leg-spinner] to bowl to me in...rough area around...crease where we'd made marks from our spikes," he added.

171.title: BJP fields Agnimitra Paul against Shatrughan Sinha for Asansol by-poll
171.article_body: The BJP has fielded fashion designer-turned-politician Agnimitra Paul against TMC candidate Shatrughan Sinha for the Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Similarly, the party has fielded Keya Ghosh against ex-Union Minister Babul Supriyo, who has been given a ticket by the TMC, for the by-election from Ballygunge seat. The by-polls for the two seats will be held on April 12.

172.title: Decision to quit BJP prompted by politics of hatred: Babul Supriyo
172.article_body: TMC leader Babul Supriyo, who quit BJP last year, said the decision was prompted by politics of "hatred and divisiveness" practised by its members. He further said he couldn't accept BJP leadership's "refusal to acknowledge...good work of a Bengali". BJP national secretary Anupam Hazra responded saying it's "ironical he didn't discover these traits and vices" when he was a minister.

173.title: Stop spreading threats against Russians on YouTube: Russia tells Google
173.article_body: Russian media regulator Roskomnadzor on Friday urged Google to stop spreading "anti-Russian" content on YouTube. "The actions of YouTube's administration are of a terrorist nature and threaten the life and health of Russian citizens," it said. Earlier this week, Russia blocked Instagram after its parent firm Meta allowed Ukrainian users to post messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

174.title: Google Maps down for several users globally, reason unknown
