174.article_body: Google Maps went down for several users globally. According to Down Detector, the issues with the service started at around 9.15 pm IST. Several users complained their maps aren't loading, while others said they're getting a message reading 'Map's can't reach the internet'. In India, several users from Delhi, Ahmedabad, Kolkata, Mumbai and Hyderabad reported issues, as per Down Detector.

175.title: German parliament approves new law to lift most COVID-19 restrictions
175.article_body: Germany's parliament, known as the Bundestag, on Friday approved a new law in a 388-277 vote that lifted most COVID-19 restrictions. Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said the new Infection Protection Act was a "difficult compromise". Germany's Robert Koch Institute on Friday reported 2,97,841 new COVID-19 cases. Wearing of masks is no longer required in schools, shops or restaurants.

176.title: We're not here to prove anything: Hardik on GT's approach ahead of IPL
176.article_body: Talking about Gujarat Titans' approach ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, skipper Hardik Pandya said they are not in the tournament to "prove anything". He added, "We're here to make sure that the environment is right for...players to flourish in their own capacity." New franchise GT will begin their IPL campaign against fellow tournament debutants Lucknow Super Giants on March 28.

177.title: COVID-19 pandemic is far from over: WHO
177.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has stated that COVID-19 pandemic is far from over. "We are definitely in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic," WHO spokesperson Dr Margaret Harris said. After more than a month of decline, COVID-19 cases have started to increase around the world last week, the WHO said.

178.title: Russian oligarch's superyacht stuck in Norway as no one is selling it fuel
178.article_body: A superyacht owned by a Russian oligarch is stuck in a Norwegian port because no one is willing to sell it fuel in protest of the Ukraine war. The Ragnar is valued at $85 million and is owned by Vladimir Strzhalkovsky. Meanwhile, the yacht’s captain said that none of the crew is Russian and that such discrimination is "extremely unjust".

179.title: Over 18,000 Ukrainians granted EU citizenship in 2020: Eurostat
179.article_body: The European Union's (EU) statistics office Eurostat on Friday said around 18,100 Ukrainians were granted citizenship of EU countries in 2020, mainly by Poland and Germany. Eurostat data showed over 7,29,000 foreign nationals were granted citizenship by the EU's 27 member states. Ukrainians made up 3% of new citizens in 2020. Poland naturalised about 3,900 Ukrainians, most in the EU.

180.title: Man rapes Dutch woman in Jaipur after she calls him for Ayurvedic body massage
180.article_body: A man raped a 31-year-old Dutch woman after she called him for Ayurvedic body massage at a hotel in Jaipur. Police have arrested the accused named Biju Murlidharan, who was living in a rented accommodation in the Khatipura area of the city. "A medical examination of the woman has also been done and the accused is being interrogated," police said.

181.title: I've heard there's no coach like him: DC's Mandeep on head coach Ponting
181.article_body: Praising Ricky Ponting, DC batter Mandeep Singh said he's keenly looking forward to working with head coach of the franchise, adding he's heard people say that there's no coach like him. "He's one of the legends of the game...he's someone who maintains a healthy team atmosphere," he added. Mandeep was bought by DC for ₹1.1 crore in 2022 mega auction.

182.title: 1 BSF jawan dead, another missing as vehicle falls into water in Assam
182.article_body: One BSF personnel died after the vehicle he was travelling in with four others plunged into a water body in Assam's South Salmara Mankachar district along the Indo-Bangladesh border. Three personnel were rescued, however, a search operation is underway for the driver, who is missing. "It's suspected that the driver of the vehicle had lost control," a senior officer said.

183.title: I would love to see the now version of 'Friends': Lisa Kudrow
183.article_body: Actress Lisa Kudrow, who portrayed Phoebe Buffay on 'Friends', has said that she'd love to see a reboot of the series with an all-new cast and what the "now version" of it would be. Lisa and Jennifer Aniston, David Schwimmer, Matt Leblanc, Courteney Cox and Matthew Perry had earlier come together for a reunion episode which aired in May 2021.

184.title: Lakshya Sen, Gayatri Gopichand-Treesa Jolly enter All England semis
184.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen entered men's singles semi-finals of All England Championships after his opponent Lu Guang Zu of China gave a walkover on Friday. Ex-champion Pullela Gopichand's daughter Gayatri along with her partner Treesa Jolly saved two match points to reach women's doubles semi-finals after beating second seeds Lee Sohee and Shin Seungchan 14-21, 22-20, 21-15.

185.title: What are the 'Kamikaze' Switchblade drones that US is sending to Ukraine?
185.article_body: The 'Kamikaze drones' or the Switchblade drones are equipped with cameras, guidance systems and explosives, and can be carried in a backpack. The 'Kamikaze drones' are capable of circling above a target until the moment they can strike it with precision. The 'Kamikaze' attacks were a Japanese suicide bombing tactic deployed to attack enemy warships during World War II.

186.title: Food supply chains falling apart in Ukraine: World Food Programme
186.article_body: Food supply chains in Ukraine are "falling apart" due to the conflict with Russia, a World Food Programme (WFP) official said. "Movements of goods have slowed down due to insecurity and...reluctance of drivers," the official added. Key infrastructure such as bridges and trains have been destroyed by bombs and many grocery stores and warehouses are empty, according to Reuters.

187.title: I don't know how to live: Russian oligarch after being sanctioned by EU, UK
187.article_body: A Russian oligarch revealed that he doesn’t know how to live, days after he was sanctioned by the European Union and the UK. Mikhail Fridman, whose net worth was $14 billion before the war, is now worth around $10 billion. Fridman, a co-founder of the London investment firm LetterOne, added, "I don't understand the logic behind punishing me."

188.title: Best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair: Indra Nooyi
188.article_body: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi said the best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair. In a video posted on LinkedIn, she added, "Don't wait to be invited because the invitation may never come. Actively seek out opportunities to participate and take every opportunity you can to share your talent and unique perspective."

189.title: Director Girish Malik's 17-year-old son passes away after falling from 5th floor
189.article_body: Director-producer Girish Malik's 17-year-old son Mannan passed away after falling from the fifth floor of his building in Mumbai's Andheri on Friday. Mannan was rushed to Kokilaben Ambani Hospital but he did not survive, ETimes reported. The incident happened after 5 pm when he returned to his home after celebrating Holi.

190.title: Which countries are seeing a spike in COVID-19 cases?
190.article_body: Several countries have reported a spike in COVID-19 cases in last few days. South Korea reported record more than 6,21,000 infections on Thursday. Italy reported 79,895 coronavirus cases on Thursday. In UK, the number of COVID-19 patients in hospital increased from 8,210 on March 3 to 11,346 on March 17. Germany reported 294,931 new cases in the past 24 hours.

191.title: Hundreds still trapped under theatre bombed by Russia: Ukraine
191.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that rescue work was ongoing to save hundreds of people still believed to be trapped under the rubble of a bombed theatre in Mariupol city. "There is only this information: 130 people are alive and have been taken out. The rest are waiting for help," an official said. The theatre was bombed by Russia.

192.title: No explanation: Smriti on India's inconsistent batting in Women's WC
192.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said there's "no explanation" for the team's inconsistent batting performances in ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. "Well, if I had an explanation, I would've definitely discussed [it] in...team dressing room," she added. Smriti further said the team's batting unit together hasn't clicked in the tournament so far. India are currently fourth in standings.

193.title: Team helped me stand on my feet again after I lost my father: Vandana
193.article_body: Speaking about a major turning point in her life after her father passed away in April 2021, Indian women's hockey team forward Vandana Katariya said, "The support I received from my teammates...(head coach) Janneke Schopman helped me stand on my feet again." Notably, Vandana became the first Indian woman hockey player ever to score a hat-trick at Olympics in Tokyo.

194.title: Not interested right now: Daniel on reprising Harry Potter role
194.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe has stated that he's not really interested in reprising his role of Harry Potter right now. Chris Columbus had said he wants to cast the original trio in the film adaptation of 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. "I feel like I made it out of Potter okay and I'm...happy with where I am now," Daniel added.

195.title: West Indies' Shamilia collapses on field during Women's World Cup match
195.article_body: West Indies pacer Shamilia Connell collapsed on the field during 47th over of Bangladesh's innings in a Women's World Cup match. The medical staff attended to her before taking her off the ground. She was then taken to a hospital in an ambulance. "She's a strong girl and we're backing her to get well soon," her teammate Hayley Matthews said.

196.title: NZ couple's Guinness World Record application for 'world's largest potato' rejected
196.article_body: Guinness World Records has rejected an application by a New Zealand couple, who believed they had dug up the world's largest potato weighing 7.9 kg. "Sadly the specimen is not a potato and is in fact the tuber of a type of gourd," Guinness World Records told the couple in an email following months of submitting photos and paperwork.

197.title: Pic shows 109 empty prams in Ukrainian city to honour children killed in ongoing war
197.article_body: As many as 109 empty prams were placed on the Rynok Square in Ukraine's Lviv in honour of children killed in the war against Russia. "Thatʼs the number of Ukrainian children mercilessly killed by Russian troops since the beginning of the full-scale war," Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs tweeted while sharing a picture.

198.title: OTT allows artistes, storytellers to explore global stories: Madhuri
198.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit in an interview has stated that OTT platforms allow artistes and storytellers to explore global stories. "In the medium of OTT, you can be a first-time director but you can show a story in your own language or shoot it the way you want to," the actress added. Madhuri further said that OTT offers flexibility with subjects.

199.title: Adani Group exploring buying a stake in oil giant Saudi Aramco: Report
199.article_body: Adani Group is exploring the possibility of buying a stake in oil gaint Saudi Aramco, Bloomberg reported. Billionaire Gautam Adani-led conglomerate has held preliminary talks on a range of potential cooperation and joint investment opportunities with Aramco and Public Investment Fund (PIF), the report said. Adani may offer PIF the opportunity to invest in infrastructure in India, it added.

200.title: Govt land worth ₹150 cr freed from encroachers in Madhya Pradesh
200.article_body: More than 100 hectares of government land worth over ₹150 crore were freed from encroachers in Madhya Pradesh's Orchha, the Niwari district Collector said. An order has been issued retaking possession of these land parcels, which were usurped using fraudulent means, he added. This includes land given to tribals on lease by the government free of cost, he further said.

201.title: Dhoni's wicket best moment in IPL 2021, want to dismiss Kohli now: Sakariya
201.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya has said picking CSK captain MS Dhoni's wicket was the best moment for him from IPL 2021. "Virat [Kohli] bhai is...one batsman I'd like to dismiss in IPL 2022," he added. Sakariya, who played his debut season of IPL for RR in 2021, was bought by DC for ₹4.2 crore at IPL mega auction last month.

202.title: Tokyo Olympics gold has motivated me to do even better: Neeraj Chopra
202.article_body: Neeraj Chopra said the javelin gold medal he won at Tokyo Olympics has motivated him to do "even better" in life. He added he wants to win his first-ever World Championships medal and defend his Commonwealth Games and Asian Games gold medals this year. He's been nominated in 2022 Laureus World Sports Awards in 'World Breakthrough of the Year' category.

203.title: Dalai Lama makes 1st public appearance after more than 2 years
203.article_body: Dalai Lama on Friday made his first public appearance in over two years after his offline engagements were cancelled due to COVID-19. While addressing a gathering in Dharamshala, Dalai Lama said he's in "good health and can even play boxing with the doctor". "This is a very beautiful day and we're getting to see his Holiness," an audience member said.

204.title: Everton’s Iwobi scores 99th minute winner to beat Newcastle 1-0 in PL
204.article_body: Everton's Alex Iwobi on Thursday scored in the ninth minute of stoppage time to help Everton beat Newcastle United 1-0 in the Premier League. The match was delayed at the start of the second-half after a pitch invader tied himself to a goalpost. The win helped Everton move three points above the relegation zone in 17th place with 25 points.

205.title: West Ham beat Sevilla 2-0, Barcelona beat Galatasaray 2-1 in Europa League
205.article_body: West Ham United on Thursday beat Sevilla 2-0, while Barcelona beat Galatasaray 2-1 in their respective Europa League last-16 second-leg ties to reach the quarter-finals. Ukrainian international Andriy Yarmolenko scored in extra-time to win the game for West Ham. Goals by Pedri and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang helped Barcelona win 2-1 after the Turkish side took the lead in the 28th minute.

206.title: Body of 21-yr-old Indian student killed in Ukraine to reach Bengaluru on Mar 20
206.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said the mortal remains of Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who was killed during shelling in Ukraine on March 1, will arrive in Bengaluru on March 20. The 21-year-old student, a resident of Karnataka's Haveri district, was standing in a  queue at a supermarket in Kharkiv when he was killed in the shelling.

207.title: Perverse abuse of power: Pope Francis on Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
207.article_body: Pope Francis on Friday condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it a "perverse abuse of power". Russia began its invasion of neighbouring Ukraine on February 24. "Once more humanity is threatened by a perverse abuse of power and partisan interests which condemns defenceless people to suffer every form of brutal violence," he said.

208.title: Red Bulls’ Perez calls for drivers to be allowed to race with COVID-19
208.article_body: Red Bull's Sergio Perez believes Formula One drivers should be allowed to race if they test positive for COVID-19. "There's so much we've learned about the virus that going forward we should discuss whether we allow the drivers to race if the symptoms are mild," he said. Aston Martin's Sebastian Vettel will miss the Bahrain Grand Prix after testing positive.

209.title: How has India ranked in World Happiness Report over the years?
209.article_body: In the 2022 World Happiness Report, India ranked 136th among 146 countries, while in 2021, it had ranked 139th among 149 countries. In 2020, India's rank was 144th, while in 2019, India was ranked 140th. In the 2018 report, it ranked 133rd and in 2017, it ranked 122nd. India was ranked 118th out of 157 countries in the 2016 report.

210.title: 'Spider-Man', 'WandaVision' win at Critics Choice Super Awards 2022
210.article_body: Marvel's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' and 'WandaVision' were awarded Best Superhero Movie and Best Superhero Series respectively at the Critics Choice Super Awards 2022. Actor Andrew Garfield won Best Actor in a Superhero Movie for his role in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Actress Florence Pugh was awarded Best Actress in a Superhero Movie for 'Black Widow'.

211.title: I'm still the girl who started 10 yrs ago, haven't mastered everything: Alia
211.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she is still the young girl who started in the film industry 10 years ago, adding she doesn't think she has mastered everything. The actress added that she will continue to learn and grow only if she doubts herself. "Being grounded is all about not believing in one's own success or failure," Alia said.

212.title: Lia Thomas becomes first transgender woman to win NCAA swimming title
212.article_body: Lia Thomas on Thursday became the first transgender woman to win an NCAA swimming title after winning the women's 500-yard freestyle. The University of Pennsylvania swimmer won with a time of four minutes and 33.24 seconds. Thomas competed on the men's team for three years before moving to the women's team. "It means the world to be here," Thomas said.

213.title: Russian soldiers shooting themselves in the legs to avoid fighting: Reports
213.article_body: Some Russian soldiers have been shooting themselves in the legs using Ukrainian ammunition to appear as if they were hit by the defenders and escape fighting. In a leaked audio clip between soldiers, one Russian said, "They’ve been shooting at us for 14 days. We’re scared. We’re stealing food, breaking into houses. We’re killing civilians."

214.title: Lives being sacrificed for senseless war: Arnold on Russia-Ukraine war
214.article_body: Actor-politician Arnold Schwarzenegger shared a video for Russian soldiers amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, saying, "Your lives, your limbs and your futures are being sacrificed for a senseless war condemned by the entire world." Arnold further said Russian government lied to its citizens and soldiers. "Russia, because of its brutality, is now isolated from the society of nations," he said.

215.title: Very important: Mandhana ahead of India vs Australia in Women's WC
215.article_body: Opener Smriti Mandhana, who is India's top-scorer in 2022 Women's World Cup so far, said match against Australia on Saturday is "very important", adding she hopes to contribute in it. "Everyone knows what happened in 2017 but...it's going to be a fresh day [tomorrow]," she added. Five years ago, India beat Australia by 36 runs to enter World Cup final.

216.title: PMC committees to operate under Administrator's leadership: Official
216.article_body: Various committees of the Pune Municipal Corporation will continue to function under the leadership of the Administrator after the five-year term of PMC's elected body ended on March 14, the Municipal Secretary said. PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar was appointed as the Administrator of the civic body. Kumar will decide on proposals submitted to the committees, the Secretary added.

217.title: Cyclist dies after boy aims water filled balloon at scooter in Maha
217.article_body: A 54-year-old cyclist died in the Virar area of Maharashtra's Palghar district after being hit by a scooter whose driver lost control as a result of being hit by a water-filled balloon. The balloon was allegedly thrown by a boy travelling on a truck. The deceased, Ramchandra Patel, died on the spot, police said, adding, a probe is underway.

218.title: Priyanka Chopra sells her Rolls-Royce Ghost to a Bengaluru-based businessman
218.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has sold her Rolls-Royce Ghost she had bought in 2013 to a Bengaluru-based businessman. While the price at which the actress sold her car isn't known yet, the base price of the car when she bought was ₹4.5 crore. Priyanka reportedly sold the car as it was not being used frequently with her having shifted base to US.

219.title: 3 injured after tempo and car collide on Mumbai's Hindmata bridge
219.article_body: Three people were injured following a collision between a tempo and a car at Mumbai's Hindmata bridge on Friday morning. No casualties were reported in the incident and the injured have been admitted to KEM Hospital. According to reports, the incident led to a huge traffic jam with queues on the bridge for about 2 kilometres.

220.title: Catholic cross vandalised at Mumbai's Vile Parle
220.article_body: Representatives of the Catholic East Indian community in Mumbai have made a representation to the police and CM after a catholic cross in Vile Parle was allegedly vandalised last week. The representation stated that a "definitive pattern" is seen in such incidents, adding, they are done with "deliberate intentions of hurting the religious sentiments of the Christian Community".

221.title: Pic shows word 'children' written around Ukrainian theatre before powerful bomb hit it
221.article_body: A satellite image has surfaced online showing a closer view of the Mariupol Drama Theatre before it was hit by a powerful bomb. In the picture, word "children" in Russian can be seen written in large white letters around the theatre. Around 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building, as per Mariupol's Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov.

222.title: I personally chased BYJU'S CEO for our 1st meeting in 2016: Unacademy CEO
222.article_body: Unacademy's Co-founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal revealed that he personally chased Byju Raveendran, the Co-founder and CEO of rival edtech startup BYJU'S, for their first meeting in 2016 when Munjal was "a young edtech entrepreneur". Munjal told Moneycontrol, "The reference I've always made is that I want Unacademy to beat BYJU'S and become the no. 1 edtech company in India."

223.title: Jaya Bachchan gets angry at photographers, video surfaces
223.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing veteran actress Jaya Bachchan getting angry at photographers clicking her pictures. In the video, Jaya can be seen sitting inside a car and talking to someone. As paparazzi came near her car, she looked at them in anger and made a hand gesture. "Why does she give such reaction every time," a user commented.

224.title: Quess Corp Founder donates ₹105 cr to IISc to set up centre for public health
224.article_body: Quess Corp Founder Ajit Isaac and his wife Sarah have committed ₹105 crore to establish a Centre for Public Health at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru. The centre will be a part of the postgraduate medical school and it will be operational by 2024. Earlier, Mindtree Co-founders donated ₹425 crore to IISc to establish the medical school.

225.title: Which are the bottom 10 countries on the World Happiness Report?
225.article_body: The United Nations’ World Happiness Report has ranked Finland to be the world’s happiest country in the world, for the fifth consecutive year while Afghanistan was named as the unhappiest country. The 10 countries at the bottom of the list included Zambia at 137th rank, followed by Malawi, Tanzania, Sierra Leone, Lesotho, Botswana, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Lebanon and Afghanistan.

226.title: I played Akshay's mother in 'Waqt' because I wanted to: Shefali Shah
226.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said that she played Akshay Kumar's mother and Amitabh Bachchan's wife in 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' because she wanted to. She added that husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah didn't want her to do it but it was her choice. Shefali is five years younger than Akshay and was 28 when she did the film.

227.title: German Chancellor Scholz defends removing most COVID-19 restrictions
227.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday defended his government's plan to remove almost all COVID-19 restrictions in the country on March 20. "We are entering a new phase of the pandemic, in which we, like nearly all our neighbouring countries, will be getting rid of nearly all protective measures," he said. Masks will be required on public transportation and hospitals.

228.title: Assam startup names tea blend after Ukrainian Prez to honour his courage
228.article_body: An Assam-based startup has launched a new brew of a "strong Assam tea" named after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to "honour his valour and courage" amid the Russian invasion. Aromatic Tea's Director Ranjit Baruah, said, "There’s nothing stronger than him at the moment in the world...I was trying to draw an analogy that this tea is as strong as Zelenskyy."

229.title: Nuis becomes 1st speed skater in history to clock 100 kmph, video goes viral
229.article_body: Dutch speed skater Kjeld Nuis broke the world record by clocking 103 kmph over natural ice on Norway’s Savalen Lake. The 32-year-old three-time Olympic champion exceeded the 100 kmph mark as he added a further 10 kmph to his existing speed record. He said, "I was literally flying over the ice...This is really the maximum that is possible on skates."

230.title: 'The Kashmir Files' earns over ₹100 crore worldwide in 7 days
230.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri-directorial 'The Kashmir Files' has surpassed ₹100-crore earnings worldwide in seven days of the film's release. Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to reveal that the film has earned ₹106.80 crore in seven days, writing, "Our film 'The Kashmir Files' is showing its true colours! Happy Holi to all!"

231.title: Big B shares pic with Jaya on Holi, granddaughter Navya photobombs
231.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan on Thursday took to Instagram to share a picture with his wife actress-politician Jaya Bachchan celebrating Holi. The actor can be seen applying tika to Jaya on her forehead and a glimpse of their granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda can be seen in the background. Their daughter Shweta Bachchan commented on the photo, "How cute. Happy Holi."

232.title: Bhagavad Gita is for all, not only for Hindus: Karnataka Edu Min
232.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that the holy book of Bhagavad Gita "is not only for Hindus, but for all". His statement comes after the Gujarat government has decided to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus for classes 6-12. He further said that "if experts say, it will definitely be introduced" in Karnataka as well.

233.title: He's irritable & forgetful: Russia as Biden calls Putin 'murderous dictator'
233.article_body: Russia said US President Joe Biden's comments about President Vladimir Putin are "personal insults". Biden had called Putin a "war criminal" and a "murderous dictator". "Given such irritability from Biden, his fatigue and sometimes forgetfulness...fatigue that leads to aggressive statements, we'll not make harsh assessments so as not to cause more aggression," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said.

234.title: I can make a film with Shah Rukh Khan in my sleep: Farah Khan
234.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan has said that she can make a film with actor Shah Rukh Khan in her sleep. She added that when the timing is right, it will fall into place. Shah Rukh has worked in Farah's 'Main Hoon Na', 'Om Shanti Om' and 'Happy New Year'. She further said that her films should get mass acclaim.

235.title: Poland to propose peacekeeping mission for Ukraine at NATO summit: PM
235.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki on Friday said that Poland will formally submit a proposal for a peacekeeping mission in Ukraine at the next NATO summit. Notably, Morawiecki and the Prime Ministers of Slovenia and the Czech Republic had recently visited the Ukrainian capital Kyiv despite the ongoing war. Several NATO nations have provided military aid to Ukraine amid the conflict.

236.title: Don't politicise legitimate energy transactions: Govt sources
236.article_body: India's legitimate energy transactions should not be politicised and countries that are either self-sufficient in oil or are importing from Russia cannot credibly advocate restrictive trading, government sources said. The remarks come amid reports of India purchasing discounted crude oil from Russia, which is facing international sanctions over its invasion of Ukraine.

237.title: I call him Pammi aunty: Pooja Hegde on 'Cirkus' co-star Ranveer Singh
237.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde opened up about sharing screen space with Ranveer Singh in the upcoming comedy film 'Cirkus' and said, "He is like full entertainment." "I call him Pammi aunty. He's just too much fun to be around, and he's so observant of everybody," she added. "We make a great onscreen pair also," Pooja further said.

238.title: World C'ships silver-medallist Kidambi loses in 2nd round of All England
238.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth lost in second round of men's singles at All England Championships in Birmingham. Fifth-seeded Anthony Sinisuka Ginting beat the World Championships silver-medallist 9-21, 21-18, 21-19. Meanwhile, the Indian duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty entered men's doubles quarter-finals after defeating Germany's Mark Lamsfuss and Marvin Seidel 21-7, 21-7.

239.title: Nation celebrating Holi, Shab-e-Barat on same day, this is beauty of India: Naqvi
239.article_body: As the country celebrates Holi and Shab-e-Barat on Friday, Union Minister for Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that this is the beauty of our country that the people celebrate all festivals. "This is Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat," Naqvi added. "Holi is the symbol of social unity, communal harmony and brotherhood," Naqvi wrote while sharing pictures on Twitter.

240.title: No player has hit a Test ton faster than Shikhar Dhawan on debut
240.article_body: Batter Shikhar Dhawan smashed the fastest hundred on a Test debut off 85 balls against Australia in the Mohali Test that ended on March 18, 2013. Dhawan overtook West Indies' Dwayne Smith, who slammed Test ton on debut off 93 balls against South Africa in 2004. Dhawan is among the 16 Indians who have hit a century on Test debut.

241.title: 98-yr-old Ukrainian woman who fought World War II offers to fight Russia, govt shares pic
241.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Twitter to share a picture of 98-year-old Olha Tverdokhlibova, who offered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Olha is a World War II veteran, the ministry stated. "Despite all the merits and experience was denied, though, because of age. We are sure, she will celebrate another victory soon in Kyiv!" it further wrote.

242.title: Norway preparing to host 1 lakh refugees amid conflict in Ukraine: PM
242.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday announced that Norway is preparing to host up to 1 lakh people fleeing the conflict in Ukraine. Norway expects to receive around 30,000 refugees from Ukraine this year, he said. Around 2,000 refugees have arrived in Norway so far and the Norwegian government said that it'll soon receive an additional 5,250 people.

243.title: 1 killed, 4 injured after parts of Russian missile fall on building in Ukraine
243.article_body: One person was killed and four others were injured after parts of a Russian missile fell on a residential building in Ukraine's capital Kyiv on Friday, emergencies services said. Twelve people were rescued and 98 people were evacuated from the five-storey building, the services added. Over 700 people have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack, the United Nations said.

244.title: Which are the world's top 10 happiest countries as India in bottom 11?
244.article_body: According to the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report, Finland has been ranked the happiest country in the world, followed by Denmark, Iceland, Switzerland, Netherlands and Luxembourg. Sweden has been ranked seven. Other countries in the top 10 are Norway, Israel and New Zealand. India has been ranked 136 among 146 countries, and Afghanistan has been ranked as the least happiest country.

245.title: Actor Vishal feeds over 200 elderly people on Puneeth's birth anniversary
245.article_body: On late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's birth anniversary on Thursday, Vishal served food to more than 200 elderly people across various old age shelters in and around Chennai. The actor, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, shared a video on Twitter, writing, "Nothing else would make my friend Puneeth more happy...on his birthday than helping these lovely ones."

246.title: Smeared in colours, CRPF jawans celebrate Holi in Srinagar
246.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel celebrated Holi in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Friday. They smeared colours on each other and danced to Holi songs to celebrate the festival. "We are enjoying the festival. Even if we are away from our family members but the personnel are also part of our family," a jawan said.

247.title: Samoa reports its first unexplained COVID-19 case in community, goes into lockdown
247.article_body: The Pacific island nation of Samoa has sealed its borders as it entered a nationwide lockdown after recording its first unexplained case of COVID-19 in the community. The case was detected in a 29-year-old on the main island of Upolu. A government report leaked online indicated the woman had taken part in church services, and visited places including a hospital.

248.title: Want to shut all 800 restaurants but our Russian partner refused: Burger King owner
248.article_body: Restaurant Brands International, the parent company of Burger King, said it wants to immediately shut all its 800 restaurants in Russia but its Russian joint venture partner has "refused" to do so.  "We can't unilaterally suspend operations" because it's a "complicated legal process", it added. Earlier, the company suspended corporate support for Russian locations amid Ukraine's invasion.

249.title: Britney Spears deletes Instagram account again, fans express concern
249.article_body: Singer Britney Spears' Instagram account was deactivated once again on Wednesday afternoon, following which many of her fans took to social media to express concern. One fan wrote, "Seems like something is going on, we'll see," while another tweeted, "Me right now panicking #BritneySpears." ET Online has reported that the singer is taking "a well-deserved break as many celebrities do".

250.title: Wrestler Sangram Singh announces wedding with Payal Rohatgi in July
250.article_body: Wrestler Sangram Singh on Thursday announced his upcoming wedding with longtime girlfriend actress Payal Rohatgi in July. Sangram tweeted that their wedding was scheduled for March but was postponed amid work commitments. This comes after Payal broke down on reality show 'Lock Upp', saying it has been 12 years since she's been dating Sangram and she wants to get married.

251.title: Fake doctor cheats Pune woman of ₹22 lakh; met her on matrimonial site
251.article_body: A woman in Pune was duped of ₹22 lakh by fraudsters who posed as a doctor on a matrimonial website. She allegedly transferred the amount to them on pretexts like air travel expenditure, gold tax, etc. over a period of eight months. She filed a complaint with the police after realising that the person she met online does not exist.

252.title: Devotees throng at Vrindavan’s Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi
252.article_body: With sweets and colours in their hands, devotees gathered in huge numbers at Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi on Friday. They were seen standing in queues to get a glimpse of their deity, Krishna at the temple. They also threw colours on the devotees gathered at the temple. Vrindavan holds a historic significance for the festival of Holi.

253.title: Godzilla actor Akira Takarada dies aged 87
253.article_body: Japanese actor Akira Takarada, known for his role in the original Godzilla, has died at the age of 87. Takarada's death was announced by Toho Studios, the production company responsible for the 1954 movie. In Godzilla, Takarada played Hideto Ogata, a sailor who works with the Japanese Coast Guard after Godzilla sinks a boat.

254.title: ₹2,000 cash found at unicorn founder's home after 3-day I-T raid on Infra.Market
254.article_body: The I-T department conducted a three-day raid at the offices of unicorn startup Infra.Market and the residences of Founders Souvik Sengupta and Aaditya Sharda. It found ₹2,000 in cash and jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh at Sengupta's residence and cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh each at Sharda's residence. No unaccounted cash or assets were found at its offices, Moneycontrol reported.

255.title: About 300 ships carrying grain exports stopped by Russian forces
255.article_body: Russian forces have stopped around 300 ships carrying grain exports from leaving the Black Sea amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. The administrator of the Panamanian Maritime Authority Noriel Arauz said three Panamanian-flagged ships have been struck by Russian fire since the invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Russia produces nearly 80 million metric tons of wheat per year.

256.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to be screened for Bihar MLAs, MLCs in Patna on Mar 25
256.article_body: The Bihar government is going to arrange a special screening of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' for MLAs and MLCs of the state. The film will be screened in Patna at 6.30 pm on March 25. "The movie is based on the plight of Kashmiri Pandits...It needs to be watched by more and more people," Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad said.

257.title: 'Skip Intro' button used 136 mn times a day, saves users’ 195 years: Netflix
257.article_body: In a blog post, Netflix has revealed that its 'Skip Intro' button is pressed about 136 million times each day, saving users across the world a cumulative time of 195 years. Explaining how the ‘Skip Intro’ feature was created five years ago, Netflix stated that 15% of the time customers were manually advancing the series within the first five minutes.

258.title: Japan announces further sanctions on Russian officials, arms exporter
258.article_body: Japan on Friday said it will impose sanctions against 15 Russian individuals and nine organisations including the state-owned arms exporter Rosoboronexport. Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Japan's finance ministry said Japan has sanctioned 76 individuals, seven banks and 12 organisations. "These sanctions hit at the heart of Russia's war machine," US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel said.

259.title: Court acquits 2 serving life imprisonment for double murder in Pune
259.article_body: Two men who were serving life imprisonment in connection with the murder of an elderly couple in the Pune district were acquitted by Bombay High Court on Thursday. The couple was murdered in 2009. The court said the trial court was not justified in arriving at the conclusion that the prosecution has proved its case beyond a reasonable doubt.

260.title: UK revokes Russian channel RT's licence amid probe into Ukraine war coverage
260.article_body: UK media regulator has revoked the licence of Russian-backed broadcaster RT amid probe into the impartiality of its coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We don't consider RT's licensee, ANO TV Novosti, fit and proper to hold...UK broadcast licence," the regulator, Ofcom, said. This move by Ofcom shows that "it's nothing more than a tool of government", RT said.

261.title: India celebrates Holi in Auckland ahead of Australia match in Women's WC
261.article_body: India, who are currently playing in 2022 Women's World Cup, celebrated Holi in Auckland before their next match against Australia on Saturday. BCCI Women posted a picture on Twitter and wrote, "Ringing in the festivities post practice in Auckland. Here's Team India wishing everyone a Happy Holi all the way from New Zealand." India have two wins from four matches.

262.title: Train services between India, Bangladesh likely to resume from March 26
262.article_body: The train services of Maitree Express and Bandhan Express between India and Bangladesh are likely to resume from March 26, said the Ministry of Railways on Thursday. The decision is subjected to the clearance of the Ministry of Home Affairs, the Railways added. The train services between the two countries were suspended in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

263.title: NASA rolls out its mega Moon rocket for 1st time, shares pics
263.article_body: NASA has rolled out its mega Moon rocket for the first time. The vehicle, known as the Space Launch System (SLS), along with the Orion capsule atop, was taken to the pad at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida to conduct a dummy countdown. NASA is targeting May as the earliest window for Artemis-1, an uncrewed lunar mission.

264.title: Oil protestor ties himself by neck to goalpost during PL match, pic goes viral
264.article_body: Everton-Newcastle United Premier League match was held up for eight minutes on Thursday after a protestor tied himself to the goalpost at the Gwladys Street end of Goodison Park. The invader was wearing a jersey with the words 'Just Stop Oil'. "[UK] government must end all new fossil fuel supply projects," the group claiming responsibility for the stunt said.

265.title: Robert Pattinson's The Batman crosses $500 million at worldwide box office
265.article_body: Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' has earned over $500 million at the worldwide box office. The film, which was made on a budget of $200 million, earned over $258.3 million in the US and over $247 million in international markets, as per a report. "We congratulate...the entire cast and crew on this wonderful benchmark," Warner Bros Pictures chairman Toby Emmerich said.

266.title: TV actress among those rescued as prostitution racket busted in Goa
266.article_body: The Goa Crime Branch on Friday said it has arrested a Hyderabad-based man named Hafiz Syed Bilal and rescued three women, including a television actress, after busting a prostitution racket. Two of the rescued women, including the TV actress, are from Virar near Mumbai. "Information was received...and accordingly a trap was laid," the police said.

267.title: Jharkhand's mob lynching bill is not legal: BJP state President
267.article_body: Jharkhand BJP President Deepak Prakash has termed the state's 'Prevention of Mob Violence and Mob Lynching Bill, 2021' as "not legal" and a bill passed by the state assembly for "politics of appeasement". He backed the state Governor Ramesh Bais for returning the draft of the bill and also stated that the bill will "disrupt social harmony" in Jharkhand.

268.title: Narmada project participating states yet to pay ₹7,225 cr to Gujarat: CM
268.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel said that Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Rajasthan, the three participating states of the Sardar Sarovar Narmada Yojana, are yet to give ₹7,225 crore to Gujarat. Madhya Pradesh has to pay ₹4,953.42 crore, Maharashtra ₹1,715.67 crore and Rajasthan ₹556 crore to Gujarat. In the past two years, Madhya Pradesh did not pay anything, Patel added.

269.title: Kim's boyfriend Pete Davidson won't be going to space on Blue Origin flight
269.article_body: American comedian Pete Davidson, who's currently dating socialite Kim Kardashian, will not be flying to space on Blue Origin's upcoming spaceflight, billionaire Jeff Bezos-led space tourism company said as it delayed the launch. The development comes days after Blue Origin announced Davidson would be one of the six passengers on its next spaceflight. It did not provide any further detail.

270.title: Taliban bans broadcast of all foreign TV shows in Afghanistan: Report
270.article_body: The Taliban has banned the broadcast of all foreign TV series in Afghanistan, as per a report. A participant at the meeting of Afghan broadcasters said, "The Taliban clearly said to stop showing any foreign TV series translated into Dari or Pashto [official languages of Afghanistan]." Report added that the authorities said they won't accept any excuses for violating this.

271.title: Diljit Dosanjh to portray singer Amar Singh Chamkila in his biopic: Reports
271.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has reportedly been roped in to play the role of Amar Singh Chamkila in an upcoming film based on the life of the late musician. The biopic will be directed by filmmaker Imtiaz Ali. Amar and his wife, Amarjot, were killed, along with two members of their band in March 1988 in an assassination which remains unresolved.

272.title: I'd give anything to see you smile 1 more time: Leone on mom's death anniversary
272.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Friday, Sunny Leone penned a note remembering her mother on her death anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her parents, she wrote, "14 years ago today you left us but every day I miss you more...and would give anything to see you smile and call me Googu one more time. Love you Mumma!"

273.title: It's time to break away from societal stereotypes of wedding: Yami
273.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has said it's high time to break away from societal stereotypes for wedding ceremonies. She further said she'd have opted for a minimalist wedding even if it wasn't held during the pandemic. "I would have still worn my mother's sari, my grandmother's nath, dupatta and the aatheru (traditional Kashmiri ear ornament) given by my in-laws," Yami added.

274.title: Rare and deadly virus found in ticks in 6 US states: Study
274.article_body: Scientists have found a rare but potentially deadly Heartland virus in lone star ticks in Georgia. Its RNA has been detected in immature and mature ticks in Missouri, Alabama, Illinois, Kansas and New York so far. In 2009, two men were hospitalised with high fever, diarrhoea, muscle pain and symptoms similar to Lyme disease marking the virus' first case.

275.title: Andaman MP urges Lt Guv to put disaster machinery on high alert ahead of cyclone
275.article_body: Andaman and Nicobar Islands MP Kuldeep Rai Sharma has urged the Lieutenant Governor to put the islands' disaster management machinery on high alert after the IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. Rai has also requested Lieutenant Governor Admiral (Retd) DK Joshi to declare a holiday in schools and colleges on March 19 and 21.

276.title: I played Calendar in Mr. India, then did that in 150 films: Satish
276.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has stated that he played Calendar in 1987 film 'Mr. India' and everyone thought that he can only make people laugh. "And I ended up doing that in 150 films!" the actor added. He further said that earlier an actor could get typecast very quickly, adding it was an "innocent age" with no exposure to world cinema.

277.title: May the spirit of Holi fill our lives with happiness, peace: Kohli
277.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share his wishes on the occasion of Holi. "May the spirit of this festival fill our lives with happiness and peace. Happy Holi to all," he wrote. VVS Laxman tweeted, "May the colours of Holi spread peace, happiness, love and prosperity all around. Wishing you a blessed and Happy Holi."

278.title: Delhi education department asks schools to step up vaccination of 12-14 age group
278.article_body: The Directorate of Education (Delhi) has asked schools to take charge of getting their students in the 12-14 age group vaccinated. In a directive issued by the directorate, the class teachers must ensure that parents are informed to inoculate their children. Schools designated as COVID-19 vaccination centres (CVCs) have been asked to make provisions for separate rooms and extra staff.

279.title: Mamata Banerjee slams EC for rescheduling board exams over elections
279.article_body: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday slammed the election commission for rescheduling class 12 board exams in West Bengal due to byelections of Asansol Lok Sabha seat and Ballygunge assembly constituency. "Had the byelections been conducted along with the recent assembly elections in the five states, students would not have to face this problem," she said.

280.title: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri gets 'Y' category security: Reports
280.article_body: The Centre has granted a 'Y' category security to Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, the director of 'The Kashmir Files,’ reports said. The 'Y' category security cover involves the deployment of four to five armed commandos in close proximity of the protectee. After the release of the movie based on the lives of Kashmiri Pandits, Agnihotri was receiving threats on social media.

281.title: Delhi workers who lost income due to construction ban to get ₹5,000
281.article_body: Delhi government has decided to give ₹5,000 aid to 83,183 workers who lost their income due to the construction ban amid pollution spike in 2021. "These workers are the builders of our nation...Construction activities were banned in Delhi earlier which affected the livelihood of workers," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. There are 11 lakh construction workers in Delhi, he added.

282.title: 30 stranded whales die on beach in New Zealand: Govt
282.article_body: New Zealand's Department of Conservation has said that around 30 pilot whales have died after being stranded on a beach. "The cause of this stranding is not known, but Golden Bay is a high stranding area with Farewell Spit hooking around the northern entrance into the bay," it added. About 34 pilot whales were stranded in the area.

283.title: Ukrainian CEO featured in Forbes' rich list stays behind in Kharkiv to help rescuers
283.article_body: A Ukrainian businessman, ranked among wealthiest Ukrainians, chose to stay back in Kharkiv to help local defenders and rescuers, a media report said. Vsevolod Kozhemyaka, CEO of Agrotrade Group, has been posting images and videos related to attacks on Kharkiv on Instagram. He was on the 88th spot in Forbes' list of 100 richest people in Ukraine in 2020.

284.title: Western sanctions starting to have real impact on Russia: France
284.article_body: Sanctions imposed by Western countries on Russia over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine are starting to have a "real impact", French government spokesman Gabriel Attal said on Friday. "We hope these sanctions will force [Russian President] Vladimir Putin to change his plans," he added. Earlier this week, the European Union member states agreed on the fourth package of sanctions against Russia.

285.title: Vicky, Katrina share pics from their 1st Holi after wedding
285.article_body: Actors Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif took to Instagram to share pictures from their first Holi together after their wedding. The pictures also feature Vicky Kaushal's parents and his brother Sunny Kaushal. Vicky and Katrina got married on December 9 last year in a traditional Hindu ceremony at the Six Senses Fort Barwara in Sawai Madhopur, Rajasthan.

286.title: Haryana man claims Apple Watch's ECG feature saved his life; CEO Tim Cook replies
286.article_body: A 34-year-old Haryana man claimed that an Apple Watch saved his life after its ECG feature detected irregularities. Nitesh Chopra said he went to the hospital and the angiography revealed there was a 99.9% blockage in his arteries. His wife then emailed Apple CEO Tim Cook thanking him, to which Cook replied saying, "I'm so glad you sought medical attention."

287.title: 103-year-old man jailed for 10 years for sexually assaulting 10-yr-old girl in TN
287.article_body: A 103-year-old man has been convicted and sentenced to 10 years rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting a 10-year-old girl in 2018. Police said the man, a retired government school headmaster, lured the girl promising to get her a chocolate. Her parents came to know about the crime when she complained of stomach ache.

288.title: Not easy for Mayank to lead PBKS who haven't done justice to talent: Gavaskar
288.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said it is not going to be easy for Mayank Agarwal to lead PBKS, who have not done justice to their talent over the years. PBKS have reached the playoffs in an edition of the IPL twice in 15 seasons. PBKS will play their first game of IPL 2022 on March 27 against RCB.

289.title: 100 endangered vultures found dead in Assam, food poisoning suspected
289.article_body: Carcasses of almost 100 endangered vultures were found in the Chhaygaon area of Kamrup, Assam on Thursday. Dimpi Bora, District Forest Officer (DFO), said, "We have found some bones nearby the carcasses. We suspect that the vultures died after eating the poisonous goat carcass." She further added that the actual cause of death will come out in the post-mortem report.

290.title: Russian forces raping women aged over 60 before hanging them: Ukrainian MP
290.article_body: Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko, while speaking to journalists in the House of Commons, said that  Vladimir Putin has "changed his strategy to target the most vulnerable groups of women and children". She added that Russian forces are raping women aged over 60 before executing them. She further said that several women died by suicide after being sexually abused.

291.title: Kolkata Knight Riders launch their new jersey, share pic
291.article_body: Two-time IPL champions Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) have launched their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The new jersey features a lot more gold palette in the kit. KKR CEO Venky Mysore and captain Shreyas Iyer were present at the jersey launch. KKR will face Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in IPL 2022 opener on March 26.

292.title: Kyrgios shares screenshots of Instagram chat with ball kid he almost hit with racquet
292.article_body: After his Indian Wells Masters quarter-final defeat against Rafael Nadal, Nick Kyrgios hurled his racquet on the ground. The racquet bounced away and almost hit a ball kid. Kyrgios put out an apology on Instagram after the match and sought help in tracking down the ball kid. He later shared screenshots of his Instagram chat with the ball kid.

293.title: Putin won't be able to use Botox due to sanctions: Reports
293.article_body: Due to the sanction imposed on Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine, President Vladimir Putin won't be able to use Botox, reports said. Abbvie, which owns the wrinkle treatment product, has said it has temporarily suspended operations for all its aesthetic products in Russia, reports added. The use of Botox by Putin has been widely reported by several media outlets.

294.title: Willing to provide Ukraine S-300s if NATO fills gap: Slovakia
294.article_body: Slovakia's Defence Minister Jaroslav Nad said his country is willing to provide Ukraine with S-300 air defences if NATO provides a replacement. US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin, who was speaking alongside the Slovakian minister, declined to say whether the US might be willing to fill the gap. Ukraine has appealed to Western nations for air defences to fight Russian invasion.

295.title: Anyone thinking women’s cricket is boring has got their head in sand: Shikha
295.article_body: India Women pacer Shikha Pandey tweeted, "Anyone who still says or thinks women's cricket is boring has clearly got their head in the sand and is not watching it." "Agree with you. It is competitive and interesting," read a response to her tweet. "It is more exciting than men's cricket as the latter has become so predictable," stated another reaction.

296.title: I will add Babar in 'Fab 5': Saba Karim on choosing between Babar, Rohit
296.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said he will add Babar Azam if the 'Fab Four' is to be expanded to 'Fab Five' for Test cricket, ahead of India skipper Rohit Sharma. "Rohit...because his impact is fantastic. He is an ultimate match-winner," responded former India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi. Babar scored 196 in the second innings of Pakistan's Karachi Test against Australia.

297.title: Has very limited talent, shots but good intention: Akhtar on Rizwan's 104*
297.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Muhammad Rizwan who scored an unbeaten 104 in Pakistan's Karachi Test against Australia, former Pakistani pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he has very limited talent and shots but good intention. "I feel the way Rizwan plays, he will be remembered for years to come," added Akhtar. "Rizwan plays like there's no pressure...at all," stated Akhtar.

298.title: Not at liberty to refuse players chance to take part in IPL 2022: CSA
298.article_body: With no IPL-bound players like Kagiso Rabada selected for South Africa's Tests against Bangladesh, Cricket South Africa said it is not at liberty to refuse players the chance to take part in IPL 2022. South Africa Test skipper Dean Elgar had earlier said players should remember that performances for the national team earned them a chance to play in IPL.

299.title: Re-designate Chennai as embarkation point for Haj pilgrims: TN CM to Centre
299.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has requested the Centre to take steps to re-designate Chennai as an embarkation point for the Haj 2022 pilgrims. Every year over 4,000 Haj pilgrims from Tamil Nadu proceed on the pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia from Chennai, Stalin added. Pilgrims from Tamil Nadu are made to travel over 700 kilometres to Cochin, the CM stated.

300.title: Russian fast-food chain reveals logo nearly identical to McDonald's
300.article_body: A Russian fast-food chain called Uncle Vanya has filed to trademark a logo that looks nearly identical to Golden Arches of McDonald's. The logo that shows the Cyrillic letter 'Ve', representing 'V' in Vanya, also uses the red and yellow colour scheme associated with McDonald's. After McDonald's shut 850 restaurants, Russia's State Duma suggested replacing it with Uncle Vanya.

301.title: Mumbai Police's 'Let's not Holi-cinate' post goes viral
301.article_body: Mumbai Police's post on Holi, that read, "Let's not Holi-cinate," has gone viral on social media. "Play with colors, not imagine them! We will catch you 'red-handed' otherwise," Mumbai Police wrote. Reacting to the post, social media users wrote, "Nailed it! Totally savage," and "Bang on Creative Team. Salute."

302.title: Aircraft repair plant in Lviv destroyed by Russian cruise missiles: Ukraine
302.article_body: Several missiles hit an aircraft repair plant in the Ukrainian city of Lviv on Friday, destroying its building, the city's Mayor Andriy Sadovy said. The plant wasn't in operation at the time of the strike and there were no casualties, he added. The plant was struck by cruise missiles launched from the direction of the Black Sea, Ukraine's military said.

303.title: ISKCON temple attacked by mob of 200 people shouting 'Allahu Akbar' in Bangladesh
303.article_body: An ISKCON temple was attacked by a mob of around 200 people shouting "Allahu Akbar" in Bangladesh's Dhaka, with videos of the incident surfacing on social media. Commenting on the attack, the Hindu American Foundation (HAF) said, "They vandalised the temple, murti, and looted money and other valuable things. At least 3 Hindu devotees were injured during this attack."

304.title: Rafael Nadal beats Nick Kyrgios in quarter-final at Indian Wells
304.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated Nick Kyrgios 7-6(7-0), 5-7, 6-4 in the quarter-final match at Indian Wells Masters on Thursday. Nadal will now play against compatriot Carlos Alcaraz Garfia in the semi-final on Saturday. After the match, Nadal said, "Nick is one of these players that you're going to have problems with when he's motivated, so I'm happy for the victory."

305.title: Sanjay Dutt meets former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf in Dubai; picture goes viral
305.article_body: Bollywood actor Sanjay Dutt met former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf reportedly at a gym in Dubai. In a picture that has been shared widely on social media, Musharraf can be seen sitting in a wheelchair while Sanjay is pointing towards something. Several reports stated that Sanjay and Musharraf met accidentally.

306.title: When we were complete: Neetu shares old video of Raj Kapoor's Holi party
306.article_body: Raj Kapoor's daughter-in-law and actress Neetu Kapoor on Friday wished her fans and followers on the occasion of Holi. Taking to Instagram, she shared an old video from one of Raj's Holi parties. The one-minute video also featured the actress' late actor-husband Rishi Kapoor. "When we were complete when there was love warmth. Happy Holi," Neetu wrote.

307.title: Sara's outlook towards work is so refreshing: 'Gaslight' co-star Vikrant
307.article_body: Vikrant Massey, who's set to share the screen space with Sara Ali Khan in the upcoming film 'Gaslight', spoke about his co-star and said that she is wonderful and full of energy. "Her outlook towards her work, the way she sees the world, is so refreshing," he added. The suspense drama will also feature Chitrangda Singh.

308.title: When daughter saw poster of Abhay 2, she asked 'Why is daddy so angry': Kunal
308.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu has said when his four-year-old daughter, Inaaya, saw the poster of the web show 'Abhay 2', she asked, "Why is he (Kunal) looking so angry?" "Then we made her understand papa is playing a cop, whose job is to scare people," he added. "She has an idea that we do something where we get respected," Kunal said.

309.title: Prima facie proof that Deshmukh used influence in police transfers: Court
309.article_body: Rejecting former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's bail, a court said that there is prima facie proof that he exercised his influence in the transfer of police officials. He was arrested in November 2021 by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money-laundering case. Deshmukh was accused of accepting bribes along with the co-accused Sachin Waze.

310.title: Can't penalise parties for not fulfilling promises: Allahabad HC
310.article_body: The Allahabad High Court observed that political parties can't be penalised for being unable to fulfil the promises made in their election manifesto. The court ruled after dismissing the petition filed by Khurshidurehman S Rehman who sought a criminal case against the BJP for allegedly failing to fulfil the promises made during the Lok Sabha elections in 2014.

311.title: Chennai boy solves Rubik's Cube in 14.32 secs on bicycle, sets Guinness World Record
311.article_body: A boy from Chennai has created a Guinness World Record by solving Rubik's Cube in just 14.32 seconds while riding a bicycle after working on his skills for two years. "Jayadharshan Venkatesan...was steering, pedalling and solving this cube whilst keeping his balance," Guinness World Records said, sharing his video on Instagram. Jayadharshan's achievement is put under the category of "speedcubing".

312.title: Mumbai Police removes 358 abandoned vehicles causing traffic congestion in city
312.article_body: Mumbai Police on Thursday removed 358 abandoned vehicles, which were clogging the roads leading to traffic congestion and bottlenecks in the city. Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey took to Twitter to say that police are now looking for bigger lorries to move the abandoned vehicles to Deonar. Pandey said police received "great support" from the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

313.title: Man stabs teacher 101 times, 30 years after "humiliation" at school in Belgium
313.article_body: A 37-year-old man who said he felt "humiliated" by his teacher in primary school has confessed to stabbing her to death in 2020, Belgian prosecutors said on Thursday. Gunter Uwents, who stabbed the teacher 101 times, said he never got over comments Maria Verlinden made about him in early 1990s. The murder had gone unsolved despite repeated Belgian police enquiries.

314.title: Wealthy Russians have up to $214 billion stashed in Swiss bank accounts
314.article_body: Wealthy Russians have stashed up to $214 billion in secretive Swiss bank accounts, the Swiss Bankers Association (SBA) has revealed. However, SBA said the amount of Russian wealth held in Switzerland was small compared with total assets held in the country. Switzerland "must do everything possible to turn off the money taps", Social Democrats' co-president Mattea Meyer said.

315.title: Chinese jet enters Taiwan air defence zone; 12th intrusion this month
315.article_body: Chinese fighter jet entered Taiwan's air defence identification zone (ADIZ) on Thursday, marking the 12th intrusion this month. In response, Taiwan issued radio warnings, sent planes, and deployed air defence missile systems to track the Chinese aircraft. Reportedly, 38 Chinese planes, including 26 fighter jets and nine spotter planes, have been spotted in Taiwan's ADIZ in March so far.

316.title: US man caring for his partner in Ukraine hospital killed while waiting in bread line
316.article_body: A US citizen who had been caring for his partner in a Ukrainian hospital was killed by Russian fire as he waited in a bread line after briefly stepping out to buy food, his family said on Thursday. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken confirmed the death of the American, identified by his sisters as Jimmy Hill.

317.title: 3 arrested in connection with 60 chain-snatching incidents in NCR in 2 yrs
317.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested three persons in connection with at least 60 incidents of chain-snatching in National Capital Region (NCR) in the past two years. Police have also seized a motorcycle, a gold chain, a locally-made revolver and three live cartridges from the accused. Police added that the accused confessed to committing chain-snatching in Rewari, Dharuhera and Gurugram.

318.title: Pressure tournaments are coming, want to see how Rohit reacts: Hogg
318.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said he wants to see how Team India captain Rohit Sharma reacts under pressure, with crucial tournaments like a four-match Test series at home against Australia coming up. "Will he keep that same calm body language or will we see a little bit of temper?" added Hogg. "[It will]...be tough for Rohit," stated Hogg.

319.title: Delhi records season's warmest day as temperature rises to 36.1°C
319.article_body: Delhi on Thursday recorded the season's warmest day as the maximum temperature reached 36.1°C, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "In the coming days, the temperature is expected to rise but it will not touch 40°C as there would be winds," an IMD scientist RK Jenamani added. The minimum temperature in Delhi on Thursday was recorded at 19.9°C, IMD stated.

320.title: 88-yr-old man booked for raping 11-yr-old girl kills self in Gurugram
320.article_body: An 88-year-old man, who was booked for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl, died by suicide in Gurugram, police said. The girl's mother alleged that the suspect lured her daughter by offering her a sweet and raped her at his house, police added. The man allegedly killed himself after he came to know that the victim's family had approached the police.

321.title: 15 arrested for pelting stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar
321.article_body: At least 15 persons have been arrested for allegedly pelting stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar. The incident took place after three terrorists were killed in an encounter and the site was being cleared to ensure citizens' safety, police said. "In order to disperse the mob, smoke shells had to be used," police added in a statement.

322.title: Italy ready to rebuild bombed Ukrainian theatre: Culture Min
322.article_body: Italy is ready to rebuild a theatre in the besieged Ukrainian city Mariupol which was destroyed by a bomb attack, Culture Minister Dario Franceschini said. According to Ukrainian authorities, the theatre was bombed by Russia while people were sheltering in it. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked the minister. "Together we will rebuild the country to the last brick," Zelenskyy said.

323.title: What could become costlier in India due to the war in Ukraine?
323.article_body: Global prices of commodities and fuel have soared to unprecedented levels amid the war in Ukraine. Edible oil, food grains, corn could become costlier in India due to the war. Rare metals such as nickel, platinum, palladium, and gold could become costlier as Russia is one of the biggest exporters, and sanctions have stopped the metals from reaching global market.

324.title: 800 employees fired by UK ferry firm in a 3-minute pre-recorded Zoom video
324.article_body: UK ferry company P&O Ferries has fired 800 crew in a three-minute pre-recorded Zoom video, saying that its vessels will now "be primarily crewed by a third-party crew provider". "Your final day of employment is today," an executive said in the video. The company has denied claims that it sent security guards with handcuffs to take crew off the ships.

325.title: Horse mussels under threat due to conservation failures: Study
325.article_body: Horse mussels, a species of giant mollusc found in the UK waters could be at risk due to unprotected areas of the sea, a study has found. Marine experts have described the beds of these molluscs as biodiversity hotspots. Marine protected areas (MPAs) were also introduced to protect them but due to conservation failure, the species is at risk.

326.title: Who is a war criminal?
326.article_body: The term 'war criminal' applies to anyone who violates a set of rules adopted by world leaders known as the law of armed conflict. The rules govern how countries behave in times of war. The violations of the rules that amount to war crimes include deliberately targeting civilians, using disproportionate force, using human shields and taking hostages.

327.title: Pune Metro to rename Bhosari, Budhwar Peth stations after citizens complain
327.article_body: The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited, which is implementing the Pune Metro project, has decided to change the names of at least two stations – Bhosari and Budhwar Peth. Officials said they have been receiving complaints regarding the names of the two stations due to confusion among commuters. "We will soon send a request to the...state government," an official said.

328.title: 53-yr-old man gets life sentence for raping minor stepdaughter in Maha
328.article_body: A sessions court in Palghar convicted a 53-year-old man for raping his 15-year-old stepdaughter and sentenced him to life in jail. In an FIR filed in 2017, the girl had alleged her step-father continued to rape her even after she became pregnant. Her mother had married the accused after the girl's father passed away when she was six months old.

329.title: Aishwarya remembers dad on death anniversary, shares his old pic with Aaradhya
329.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan took to Instagram to share a post remembering her late father Krishnaraj Rai on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of her father with his granddaughter Aaradhya, and wrote, "Love you eternally dearest darling daddyyy-ajjaaa. Our guardian-angel forever and beyond…thank youuu and love you."

330.title: His defence was not the greatest: Harbhajan on Ponting's 'vulnerability'
330.article_body: Discussing Ricky Ponting whom he dismissed 10 times in Tests, more than any other bowler, Harbhajan Singh said, "Ponting used to defend with very hard hands...That...made him vulnerable. His defence was not the greatest." "My bounce was something he could not play as well as...other bowlers," added Harbhajan. Harbhajan dismissed Ponting to record his 300th Test wicket in 2008.

331.title: Bulgarian Police detain former PM Borissov after EU probes
331.article_body: Bulgarian former PM Boyko Borissov was detained on Thursday as part of a police operation linked to probes by the EU Public Prosecutor's Office, the Interior Ministry said. Prosecutors have opened 120 investigations of fraud in Bulgaria involving EU funds. Former Finance Minister Vladislav Goranov and former head of the parliamentary budgetary commission, Menda Stoyanova, have also been detained.

332.title: Sonali recreates old pics from 1998 film 'Duplicate' sets with Geeta
332.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share some pictures from the dance rehearsals of the song 'Tum Nahin Jaana' from her 1998 movie 'Duplicate'. The pictures also featured choreographer Geeta Kapur. Sonali also shared pictures of herself and Geeta recreating those old pictures on a reality show. "Circa 1996! So many memories come flooding back with these photos," she wrote.

333.title: AAP MLA from Punjab's Nabha cycles 80 km for swearing-in ceremony
333.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Punjab's Nabha (SC Reserve) Gurdev Singh Dev Mann cycled for 80 kilometres for his swearing-in ceremony as a legislator in Punjab Vidhan Sabha on Thursday. He travelled 80 kilometres one way from Nabha to Chandigarh on a cycle. Mann announced that he would take a token amount of ₹1 per month as an MLA.

334.title: Professor of law university in MP booked for sexually harassing 2 students
334.article_body: A professor of the National Law Institute University (NLIU) in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, who recently resigned over allegations of sexual harassment, has been booked for sexually harassing two students, police said. As per reports, the students have accused the professor of sending obscene messages and videos on their phones and asking them to meet him at his residence.

335.title: Nothing wrong with it: Arunoday on losing roles to more famous actors
335.article_body: Actor Arunoday Singh revealed that he has lost out on opportunities that went to bigger stars, adding that there's nothing wrong with it. Stating that the bigger stars make a project more viable, he said, "They give the project a bigger length." "That's how it works. That's my point. That's the natural way of the industry," Arunoday said.

336.title: No advantage for MI: Zaheer on IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai, Pune
336.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said there would be no advantage for the franchise with IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai and Pune, as MI won't be playing all their matches at Wankhede Stadium. Fifty-five league matches will be played at Brabourne Stadium, Wankhede Stadium and DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26.

337.title: What are MANPADS, the defence systems securing Ukraine?
337.article_body: MANPADS (Man-portable air-defence systems) are short-range surface-to-air missiles used to intercept fixed- and rotary-wing aircraft in flight. They are designed to be fired while mounted on a person's shoulder or a tripod. The US had already sent Ukraine more than 600 Stingers – a type of man-portable air defence system, amid the ongoing invasion by Russia.

338.title: Taliban to open high schools for girls next week, only female teachers for them
338.article_body: Taliban will allow girls in Afghanistan to return to class when high schools open next week, a Ministry of Education spokesperson said, months after uncertainty over full education access to girls. "There are some conditions for girls," he said, adding that female students would be taught separately from males and only by female teachers, except in areas where there's shortage.

339.title: AAP might pick Harbhajan, Chadha for Rajya Sabha from Punjab: Reports
339.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is likely to nominate Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha and IIT-Delhi Associate Professor Sandeep Pathak to the Rajya Sabha from Punjab, reports said. The elections to five out of the seven RS seats of Punjab will be held on March 31. "These are the three frontrunners for the three seats for now," said a source.

340.title: Film industry must also implement POSH Act: Kerala HC
340.article_body: The Kerala High Court asked movie production houses to form an internal complaints committee to deal with cases of women's sexual harassment, under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act of 2013 commonly known as POSH Act. An organisation with less than 10 female employees must make complaints to local complaints committee, the HC said.

341.title: Madrasa teacher arrested for sheltering terrorists at home in Bengal's Howrah
341.article_body: A madrasa teacher has been arrested for allegedly sheltering militants of banned terrorist group Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) at his rented house in Bankra in West Bengal's Howrah district. The accused has been sent to police custody for 12 days. The Special Task Force (STF) of the West Bengal Police is investigating if the accused was directly involved in terror activities.

342.title: Congress could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat: Congress' Tewari
342.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari has said the party could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat. "We lost in 2014 and 2019...Since 2014, out of 49 Assembly elections, we have lost 39 polls. We have only won four elections...therefore we are really looking at an extremely grim situation," he added. "The situation does not call for introspection alone," he further said.

343.title: 8 cyclones formed over 129 years in March, only 2 crossed coasts: IMD
343.article_body: Only eight cyclones have been formed in the month of March in over 129 years between 1891 and 2020, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Only two cyclones crossed the coast, one in 1926 and the other in 1907, IMD added. Of the eight cyclones, two have been formed in the Arabian Sea and six in the Bay of Bengal.

344.title: Dirty Russian tricks: UK Defence Min after a call from 'fake Ukraine PM'
344.article_body: UK Defence Minister Ben Wallace on Thursday ordered an inquiry after an imposter claiming to be the Ukrainian PM called him. The imposter "posed several misleading questions and after becoming suspicious I terminated the call", Wallace said. "No amount of Russian disinformation, distortion and dirty tricks can distract from Russia's human rights abuses and illegal invasion of Ukraine," he added.

345.title: Pune man arrested for killing labourer, dumping body on river bank
345.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a labourer and dumping his body on banks of river Mula in Pune. Both of them worked together. "One of them had sold a phone to the other...A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

346.title: 4 held for selling fake helicopter tickets to Mata Vaishno Devi pilgrims
346.article_body: Jammu Cyber Police with the help of Rajasthan Police arrested four persons for allegedly duping pilgrims under the name of providing helicopter tickets for Mata Vaishno Devi shrine through fake websites. After receiving complaint from Mata Vaishno Devi shrine board, police identified 40 fake ticket booking websites and tracked four fraudsters through their IP address who were operating from Kota.

347.title: Letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib during partition was a mistake: Shah
347.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, addressing an event organised by Land Ports Authority of India (LPAI), said letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib gurdwara during partition was a "mistake" as it was just six kilometres away. "I don't know what went wrong. But when a festival of first Guru used to come along, there always was a feeling of sadness," he added.
