348.title: Pant calmed down when close to fastest Test fifty causing his downfall: Hogg
348.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in India's Bengaluru Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pant calmed down while approaching the record causing his downfall. Pant was dismissed by Praveen Jayawickrama off the third ball after reaching the milestone. "All of a sudden, he was second guessing," added Hogg.

349.title: Don't want you to be broken like my dad who fought for Nazis: Arnold to Russian troops
349.article_body: In an appeal to Russian troops in Ukraine, actor Arnold Schwarzenegger said he doesn't want them to be "broken" like his father who fought for the Nazis during World War II. "My father...was...pumped up on the lies of his government. When he left Leningrad he was broken physically and mentally," he recalled. "This is an illegal war," Schwarzenegger stated.

350.title: India reports 2,528 COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries in the 24 hours
350.article_body: India has reported 2,528 new COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries, and 149 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,539 cases and 60 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,281, while the active caseload declined to 29,181.

351.title: Nawab Malik's portfolios to be temporarily given to his colleagues: NCP
351.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) has decided to "temporarily" give charge of portfolios held by jailed Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik to his cabinet colleagues from the party in the next two to four days, NCP leader Jayant Patil said. "He'll continue to be a Minister. We're not taking his resignation," Patil added. Malik was arrested "in a wrong manner", he stated.

352.title: Never wanted any player to restrain: Kumble on KL Rahul's strike rate
352.article_body: Talking about ex-Punjab Kings captain KL Rahul who drew criticism for his strike rate while leading the franchise, PBKS head coach Anil Kumble said, "I don't think we ever wanted any player to restrain himself." Rahul batted at strike rates of 129.34, 138.80 in the two seasons when he led PBKS. He will lead Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2022.

353.title: Brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots gets state government job
353.article_body: Delhi government appointed Ankur Sharma, brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma, who was killed in northeast Delhi riots in February 2020, in the state's education department. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal handed him over the appointment letter on Thursday. "We can never compensate...the loss...but I hope this...job and assistance of ₹1 crore brings the family strength," he tweeted.

354.title: It's been really scary: Justin Bieber on blood clot in wife Hailey's brain
354.article_body: Commenting on his wife Hailey Baldwin's recent medical emergency, singer Justin Bieber said, "It's been scary, you know, it's been really scary. But I know for a fact that God has her in palms of his hands, and that's a good thing." Earlier, Baldwin said she is "doing well" after experiencing stroke-like symptoms from a blood clot in her brain.

355.title: I-T dept makes highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22
355.article_body: The Income Tax department has made the highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22, according to CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra. The direct tax collection numbers for current financial year stand at ₹13.63 lakh crore as against over ₹9 lakh crore in 2020-21, he said. "The year-on-year net collections today is more by 48.4% over 2020-21," he added.

356.title: Urge India to speak out against Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine: US politicians
356.article_body: In a call with the Ambassador of India to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu, US politicians Ro Khanna and Joe Wilson urged India to speak out against Russia President Vladimir Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine. "On both sides of the aisle, friends of India are urging India to use its influence for peace," Khanna tweeted.

357.title: Australian PM posts message on Holi, says 'Holi holds even more meaning this year'
357.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison posted a message on Holi and wrote, "Namaste to all my Indian Australian friends celebrating the Festival of Colours. I want to thank Indian Australian community for the love and care you have shown...to all Australians." "The ancient Festival of Colours gathers people together for a joyous celebration...Holi holds even more meaning this year," he wrote.

358.title: Kapil Sharma, Nandita Das meet Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik amid film shoot
358.article_body: Kapil Sharma and filmmaker Nandita Das met Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Thursday. Sharing some pictures from the meeting on Instagram, Kapil wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting the honourable CM of Odisha Shri Naveen Patnaik...Thank you for...making us feel at home. Your heart is as beautiful as your state." Kapil and Nandita are shooting for a film in Bhubaneswar.

359.title: US Senators introduce bill to ban imports of Russian uranium
359.article_body: US Republican Senators have introduced a bill to ban imports of Russian uranium in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Earlier, US President Joe Biden had announced a ban on Russian oil, gas, and energy imports. "Banning Russian uranium imports will further defund Russia's war machine, help revive American uranium production, and increase our national security," Senator John Barrasso said.

360.title: Madras HC rejects plea challenging O Panneerselvam's assembly win
360.article_body: The Madras High Court rejected a voter's plea which challenged AIADMK's senior leader O Panneerselvam's election from Bodinayakanur in last year's Tamil Nadu Assembly election. Petitioner alleged that Panneerselvam had "declared false income details in his election affidavit". The plea was rejected after Panneerselvam countered by stating that he had already "declared income details".

361.title: Behave politely with patients: Punjab health department to govt hospital staff
361.article_body: Punjab government's department of health and family welfare directed the staff of all government hospitals to behave politely with patients and maintain cleanliness in hospitals. Issuing the directions, Gurinder Bir Singh, Director, Health and Family Welfare, said, "Ensure availability of free medicine and tests for the patients...Wearing uniforms must be made mandatory for the hospital staff."

362.title: 4-yr-old girl dies after airgun misfires while playing at farmhouse near Hyd
362.article_body: A four-year-old girl died at a farmhouse in Telangana's Sangareddy district near Hyderabad after an airgun misfired, leading to a bullet injury on her head. Police have detained the owner of the farmhouse for negligence and the 17-year-old son of a watchman's relative for pressing the trigger while playing with the airgun.

363.title: UK to deploy Sky Sabre missile defence system to Poland amid Ukraine war
363.article_body: The UK will deploy its Sky Sabre medium-range anti-air missile system to Poland with about 100 personnel to strengthen the security of NATO's eastern flank, Defence Minister Ben Wallace said, amid the Ukraine war. This will help Poland "protect its airspace from any further aggression from Russia", Wallace added. Reportedly, Sky Sabre can launch missiles at speeds of 2,300 mph.

364.title: 7 held for operating fake angadia firm, cheating Mumbai businessman of ₹2 crore
364.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly operating a fake angadia firm and cheating a city-based businessman of ₹2 crore. Angadia firms offer courier services to deliver money, jewellery and other valuables. The accused had allegedly taken the money from the businessman to deliver it to someone in Assam, but they did not do so, police added.

365.title: 2 Indian nationals detained at Delhi airport, 250 riflescopes recovered
365.article_body: Two Indian nationals were detained on Thursday at Delhi airport on their arrival from Bangkok. At least 250 pieces of riflescopes were recovered from their baggage. "Riflescope is a restricted item for import, and also attracts action under the Arms Act," a customs official said. CISF personnel on Wednesday caught three passengers travelling with forged documents at Delhi airport.

366.title: PM Modi, President Kovind extend greetings to nation on Holi
366.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday greeted the nation on the occasion of Holi. "May this festival of colours, a symbol of mutual love, affection and brotherhood, bring every colour of happiness in your life," PM Modi tweeted. "I wish that this festival infuses joy, enthusiasm...in the lives of all the countrymen," President Kovind said.

367.title: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets killed in Russian rocket attack
367.article_body: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets has been killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv. Shvets had been awarded one of Ukraine's highest artistic honours. "Bright memory to the talented actress! There is no forgiveness for the enemy that has come to our land," her troupe, the Young Theater, said in a statement.

368.title: Putin is a murderous dictator, a pure thug waging an immoral war: Joe Biden
368.article_body: US President Joe Biden during an address for St Patrick's Day said Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a murderous dictator, a pure thug who is waging an immoral war against the people of Ukraine". He added that the US and Ireland are working together for the first time now and "Putin is paying a big price for his aggression".

369.title: 8 workers injured as fire breaks out at industrial scrap processing unit in Pune
369.article_body: Eight persons sustained burn injuries after a fire broke out at an industrial scrap processing unit in Pune's Moshi, where used oil barrels were being cleaned. Police claimed the incident took place when oil removed from the barrels came in contact with the flame of the furnace, which was being used to heat water. The unit's owner has been booked.

370.title: Lakshya Sen defeats world no. 3 Antonsen to enter All England quarterfinals
370.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen defeated world number three Anders Antonsen in straight games to reach the men's singles quarterfinals of the All England Championships on Thursday. Lakshya defeated Antonsen with a scoreline of 21-16, 21-18. Meanwhile, PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal were knocked out after losing their respective women's singles' matches in the second round.

371.title: Real Madrid to donate €1 million to Ukrainian refugees
371.article_body: Real Madrid on Wednesday said they will donate €1 million to help Ukrainian refugees as part of their "Everyone with Ukraine" campaign, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The club said the money will be donated to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the Red Cross. The UNHCR said nearly three million refugees have fled Ukraine so far.

372.title: Chinese 'manja' injures Black Kite; found hanging from tree in Agra
372.article_body: A juvenile Black Kite was injured by the Chinese 'manja' and was found hanging from a tree in Agra's Chhipitola. The bird was rescued by the Wildlife SOS Rapid Response Unit and is being currently kept under medical observation. "While the injuries are minor, the kite is unable to fly," said Dr Ilayaraja, Deputy Director, Veterinary Services for Wildlife SOS.

373.title: India & Sri Lanka sign agreement for a $1-billion line of credit
373.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) will provide a $1-billion credit facility to Sri Lanka for the procurement of food, medicines and other essential items, the Union Finance Ministry said on Thursday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa in Delhi. The ministers discussed wide-ranging issues, the ministry added.

374.title: Want diplomatic solution to Ukraine crisis, war must stop: Uzbekistan
374.article_body: Uzbekistan on Thursday called for a diplomatic solution to the Russian invasion in Ukraine, adding that it won't recognise Ukraine's breakaway regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent. Uzbek Foreign Minister Abdulaziz Kamilov said that while it wants good ties with both Russia and Ukraine, war "must stop immediately". Uzbekistan has also said it will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

375.title: I am not in favour or against: Nadal on new tie-break system at GS
375.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he is "not in favour or against" the new 10-point tie-break when the score is 6-6 in the deciding set, which will be trialled at all four Grand Slams. "Well, I don't care much honestly. I honestly don't have a clear opinion," the 21-time Grand Slam champion said.

376.title: People only came to me with biopics after 'The Dirty Picture': Vidya
376.article_body: Vidya Balan revealed people only offered her biopics after her film 'The Dirty Picture'. "Meena Kumari, MS Subbulakshmi, Kiran Bedi...There were 10 of them that came to me at that time," she stated. Vidya, who had announced a web series on ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 2018, was asked if it's still happening. To this, she replied, "I'd hope so."

377.title: 28-yr-old stabs father to death for objecting to alcoholism in TN
377.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested in Chennai on Thursday for allegedly stabbing his father, who used to scold him over his alcoholism and for not doing any work, police said. The accused stabbed his father after the two got into a heated argument on Wednesday night, according to the police. The accused was arrested from a hideout, police added.

378.title: Smoke from a huge fire at Walmart warehouse in US visible from space
378.article_body: A plume of smoke emitted from a huge fire at a Walmart distribution centre in Plainfield, US, was so vast that it could be seen from space on Wednesday afternoon, Bloomberg said. A clip posted on Twitter by National Weather Service gave a satellite's-eye view of the smoke spreading across the surrounding area. Twenty-four fire departments are fighting the fire.

379.title: Govt reacts as judge Bhandari votes against Russia, says 'voted in individual capacity'
379.article_body: On being asked about Indian judge Dalveer Bhandari's vote against Russia at International Court of Justice, Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "He happens to be an Indian national who's a member in his individual capacity on the ICJ." "I am not going to comment on how judges vote on issues that come to the ICJ," he added.

380.title: Man kidnaps & rapes minor girl in Delhi, arrested after shootout
380.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor girl in Delhi. According to the police, the accused fired at a team when they tried to arrest him on Thursday, and he sustained a bullet injury following an exchange of fire. The police received information about his movement on Thursday, said DCP (Outer-north) Brijendra Kumar Yadav.

381.title: Marriage was never part of my imagination: Actor Rahul Bose
381.article_body: Rahul Bose revealed that, at the age of 18, he had said that he'll never get married. "My mother said, 'That's ok, we will see five or ten years from now'. If she had been alive today, she probably would have realised that I just knew," he added. "Love, togetherness, companionships? Yes...But marriage...was never part of my imagination," Rahul stated.

382.title: Films should be made on Emergency & 'firing on Ram bhakts': BJP MP
382.article_body: BJP MP Mukesh Rajput on Thursday praised 'The Kashmir Files' and stated that movies should also be made on 1975-77 Emergency and alleged firing on Ram bhakts during ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's tenure. "People should know which CM and PM committed atrocities,” he said. 'The Kashmir Files' has revealed massacre of Kashmiri Pandits which was kept hidden, Rajput added.

383.title: Stress-free Kohli could be dangerous news for opposition: Glenn Maxwell
383.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has said that stress-free Virat Kohli could be dangerous news for opposition now that he won't be captaining the side. Maxwell added, "It is amazing for him to be relaxed a bit and actually enjoy the next few years of his career without any of that sort of external pressure."

384.title: Message to save water on Holi is cultural terrorism: MP minister
384.article_body: The message to save water on Holi is an attack on Hindu festivals and is cultural terrorism, Madhya Pradesh minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "How much water do we use during Holi? Save water throughout the year...Why does such a message revolve around our festivals only?" Sarang asked. He said the message was aimed at distancing youth from Hindu festivals.

385.title: Excitement level is 100 as 'Ek Villain Returns' shoot wraps up: Mohit
385.article_body: Director Mohit Suri has announced that the shooting of 'Ek Villain Returns' has been completed. Taking to Twitter, Mohit wrote, "The excitement level is 100 as 'Ek Villain Returns' wraps up...with Arjun Kapoor and Tara Sutaria." He further added that the movie will release on July 8 across theatres. The film is the sequel to the 2014 film 'Ek Villain'.

386.title: BSF personnel dance, sing 'Rang barse' on Holi eve; video surfaces
386.article_body: Personnel of the Border Security Force (BSF) posted in Jammu's Gajansoo area celebrated Holi by playing dhol and singing Bollywood songs. In a 0.52-second video that had surfaced on Twitter, the personnel can be heard singing Holi song 'Rang barse'. They also danced to the song and played with colours.

387.title: Form panels to stop harassment of women: Kerala HC to film bodies
387.article_body: The Kerala High Court on Thursday said that film bodies and production houses have the responsibility to form an Internal Complaints Committee (ICC), as per the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace Act, 2013. "It's only a question on the formation of it and it could be either done by the Producer's Association or the Chamber," said Producer Suresh Kumar.

388.title: Woman revenue official dies by suicide in MP; no suicide note found
388.article_body: A 30-year-old woman revenue official allegedly died by suicide in Bhedaghat of Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district on Thursday, police said. The incident came to light when she didn't respond to repeated knocks on the door of her house and could not be reached by neighbours, said Bhedaghat police station in-charge, Shafique Khan. No suicide note was recovered, he added.

389.title: Having gujiya was what I loved about Holi: Manushi Chhillar
389.article_body: Former Miss World Manushi Chhillar recalled celebrating Holi in her childhood and said, "I still remember having a small pink pichkari (water gun) going around with my friends, being very excited about Holi." She further added that having gujiya was what she loved about the festival. Manushi will mark her Bollywood debut with 'Prithviraj'.

390.title: AAP ended corruption in Delhi, Mann will end it in Punjab: Kejriwal
390.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that his government eradicated corruption in Delhi, adding that the new Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann will end corruption in the state as well. He also welcomed Mann's decision of releasing a WhatsApp number on March 23, for people to share recordings if government officials ask for bribes from them.

391.title: 40 gold biscuits worth ₹2.42 cr seized by BSF near B'desh border
391.article_body: The South Bengal Frontier of the Border Security Force (BSF) on Thursday seized 40 gold biscuits worth ₹2.42 crore from an alleged smuggler, who was trying to smuggle the gold from Bangladesh to India. According to reports, troops noticed the movements of a suspect, who, upon being confronted by a jawan, threw the bag and escaped towards Bangladesh.

392.title: 23-yr-old woman's burnt body found in Nagpur; petrol cans recovered
392.article_body: A 23-year-old woman's half-burnt body was recovered by the police from a secluded place in Nagpur's Surabardi on Wednesday and empty petrol bottles were found near the body of the deceased. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Zone I) Lohit Matani said that she had been missing since Tuesday and her family had filed a complaint at the Ranapratap Nagar police station.

393.title: Over 100 civilians rescued from theatre bombed by Russia: Reports
393.article_body: Over 100 civilians on Thursday were reportedly rescued from a theatre in Mariupol that was bombed by Russia on March 16. Ukrainian officials said thousands of people, including children, had sought refuge in the theatre. Officials said 79 children have died so far and over 100 have been injured since the invasion by Russia began on February 24.

394.title: BJP leadership will choose next Manipur CM: Thongam Biswajit Singh
394.article_body: Manipur BJP leader Thongam Biswajit Singh said on Thursday that the party leadership will decide who becomes the state’s next CM. "BJP is a democratic party...I think they will have a talk with all our legislators before a decision is made,” he added. Singh's comments come amid speculations of him being a front runner for the position.

395.title: ACB seizes over ₹27 lakh cash from PWD official accused of bribery
395.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has allegedly seized over ₹27 lakh cash from an engineer of the Public Works Department (PWD), booked in a bribery case in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district. Sanjay Patil, 52, was allegedly also caught accepting a bribe of ₹40,000 from a contractor on March 12. The ACB also found 183 gm of gold at Patil's house.

396.title: People throw slippers during Holi celebrations at Patna water park
396.article_body: People were seen hurling slippers and shoes at one another while playing Holi at a water park in Patna, a video of which surfaced on social media on Thursday. As per reports, the operators of the park repeatedly asked people to stop throwing slippers but they didn't listen. Subsequently, the authorities had to fire air guns to calm the people.

397.title: Russian soldiers made to say 'Putin is a di**head' after being captured
397.article_body: Russian soldiers captured by Ukrainian forces were forced to say "Putin is a di**head", a video of which has also surfaced online. They were also made to call Russian government  "scumbags". Dressed in military clothing and a black hat, one captive said, "I really love [my wife] and I hope that she will forgive me for coming here."

398.title: Bihar-born Dr Ashish Jha named White House COVID-19 response coordinator
398.article_body: US President Joe Biden has appointed Indian-American physician Dr Ashish Jha as the new White House COVID-19 response coordinator. President Biden said Jha is "one of the leading public health experts in America" and described him as the "perfect person for the job". The 51-year-old Bihar-born Jha said, "I'm deeply honoured for this chance to serve this country I love."

399.title: Engaged US couple diagnosed with cancer 8 days apart; prepones wedding
399.article_body: An engaged couple from the US, who were about to get married in June 2022, preponed their wedding to April 9 after both the partners were diagnosed with cancer. While 23-year-old Mariah Nelesen was diagnosed with ovarian cancer on January 11, 24-year-old Clay Slenk was diagnosed with Leukaemia eight days later. "There'll be a little more...sickness before health," Clay said.

400.title: Prithvi Shaw shares quote on 'karma' after reportedly failing Yo-Yo test
400.article_body: DC opener Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram Stories to share a quote on 'karma' after reports said that he failed a Yo-Yo test at a camp at the NCA in Bengaluru. "[Please] don't judge me when you don't know my situation, [you] are creating your own karma," the quote read. The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

401.title: This looks superb and so inviting: Mahindra on pics of new highway in Manipur
401.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has praised a new highway built in Manipur. Retweeting a post by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari that featured a few photos of the Wangjing-Khonkhang section of NH-39 in Manipur, Mahindra wrote, "This looks superb and so inviting. The magic of Manipur is now much more accessible. These highways will knit India together even more tightly."

402.title: Bhagwant Mann celebrates Holi with Haryana CM, pics surface
402.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday celebrated Holi with his Haryana counterpart Manohar Lal Khattar at the Haryana Raj Bhawan in Chandigarh. The Raj Bhawan has shared pictures of the 'Holi Milan Samaroh'. Mann took oath as the Punjab Chief Minister at Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of Bhagat Singh, on Wednesday.

403.title: European Space Agency suspends joint mission to Mars with Russia
403.article_body: The European Space Agency (ESA) on Thursday said it has suspended the launch of ExoMars, its joint mission to Mars with Russia's space agency Roscosmos, over the invasion of Ukraine. "While recognising the impact of scientific exploration of space, the ESA is fully aligned with sanctions imposed on Russia by its member states," the ESA said.
